name: Account Executive_30377
description:
About us:
Our motivation to create Fleetsmith stemmed from our deep frustration with existing computer management solutions. We knew we could do a lot better. Our product is powerful, yet incredibly easy-to-use. We bring the product and design focus traditionally only associated with consumer companies to the Ã¢ÂÂenterprise softwareÃ¢ÂÂ space. WeÃ¢ÂÂre a company where product comes first, where brand and product are intertwined, and where design is not an afterthought, but is fundamental to the process of building a product our customers love.
ÃÂ 
Fleetsmith solves the computer management problem for IT and Security teams: simple and secure provisioning, configuration enforcement, and inventory of devices.
The role:
WeÃ¢ÂÂre hiring an Account Executive who is creative and determined to find solutions, no matter the challenge. As an early sales hire, youÃ¢ÂÂll help build our sales infrastructure and culture from the ground up. YouÃ¢ÂÂll grow professionally across several dimensions, including the ability to step up and help lead if you prove youÃ¢ÂÂre ready
ÃÂ 
Our Ideal Candidate Has:

2-6 years of professional experience. At least 2 years of highly successful B2B sales experience. This is a key individual contributor role
Entrepreneurial-mind with a strong drive and desire to be part of a rapidly growing business.
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment with shifting priorities.
Excellent written and oral communication, including slide presentations skills

ÃÂ 
Key Responsibilities:

Prospecting & Lead Generation: Prospect within the highly qualified free user base and upgrade users as appropriate. Partner with Marketing to generate new leads through referrals, networking, cold calls/emails, and more.
Sales: Be responsible for building your own pipeline. Sell by video conference/phone/email, conduct demos and trials with prospects, then turn them into happy customers.
Customer Success: partner with customer service to ensure key customers have a successful onboarding experience. Remain closely involved not only as the customer first tries Fleetsmith but also during their first year using Fleetsmith.
Voice of the Customer: Be an advocate for premium users of Fleetsmith. Partner with Product and Marketing teams to iterate on messaging, positioning, pricing, and packaging to identify the best fit for customer needs

ÃÂ 
What we can offer - Benefits & Perks:

Unlimited PTO
Dog friendly office
Park right outside
Full stocked kitchen
Deck out back
Top tier PPO - + 90% covered for dependants.
401K
Amazing friendly culture

ÃÂ 
FleetSmith is an equal opportunity employer and actively seeks diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
subjects: Network & Security, Management, Motivation, Religion & Spirituality, Sales, Video & Mobile Marketing

name: Android Developer_30370
description:
eTecc / Interactive is a nimble design and development studio headquartered in Naperville IL with a satellite office in Chicago's West Loop. We specialize in creating web and mobile applications, constantly push the limits of our abilities - and we work on awesome stuff. Our team works with companies at every stage of development, from funded startups who are creating new products, to established organizations who need to cultivate new technologies or digital solutions. We apply our mantra of define, explore, design and execute when creating exceptional experiences for our clients.
Opportunity
We want to hire someone like us. We are looking for a person who is excited to work alongside a growing design and development team to build awesome Android apps.ÃÂ 
Description
The Android Developer position will be responsible for architecting, writing, and managing web site applications for eTecc's portfolio of clients. This position will collaborate with other developers & designers and take an active role in the scope and definition of project requirements. The candidate will also recommend the appropriate architecture and timeline estimates.

You will participate in discovery meetings and help craft solutions to meet client deliverables.

Principal Hiring Points

Experience in building Android apps in native and non-native environments

Requirements

Demonstrates both strong teamworking abilities & the ability to work independently as necessary
Demonstrate professional demeanor and customer-focused orientation
Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational skills
Strong proficiency in the English language (written and verbal)

Benefits

Competitive salary
Health insurance coverage
Paid vacation time, sick days, and personal days
Casual Work Environment
Free snacks & coffee

name: Backend Developer_30416
description:
Cornershop Creative (https://cornershopcreative.com) is seeking an awesome, U.S.-based backend developer to join our distributed team. This will be a short-term, full-time 4-6 month engagement to help with specific projects. (We hope this will turn into a permanent full-time position, but we canÃ¢ÂÂt guarantee that at the moment.)
ÃÂ 
The core responsibility for this position will be building custom API integrations and scripting data migrations for WordPress-based websites and applications for our non-profit and small business clients. Tasks may include setting up WordPress custom post types, fields and taxonomies; troubleshooting server errors and migrating sites to different hosts; integrating WordPress data with third-party tools like SalesForce and Blackbaud products; and creating scripts to migrate data from other CMSes and data structures to WordPress. Additionally, this position may be responsible for developing and maintaining custom WordPress plugins.
ÃÂ 
While our primary need is strong PHP skills with solid experience building sites and applications in WordPress, our ideal candidate will have familiarity and eagerness to learn to code in other languages and on other frameworks (e.g. javascript, mobile app development, Laravel).
ÃÂ 
Our ideal candidate is a hard-working, curious troubleshooter comfortable working independently with little supervision who also enjoys working as part of a team that includes developers and non-developers. Since we're a distributed shop, youÃ¢ÂÂll get to work from home! Cool, right?
ÃÂ 
Some Things YouÃ¢ÂÂll Need to be Comfortable With:


Making WordPress sync data with common (and not so common) third-party REST & SOAP APIs


Crafting ingenious scripts to migrate datasets from outside systems, such as other CMSes, into WordPress, even when their character encoding isnÃ¢ÂÂt what you want it to be


WordPress theming, including the template hierarchy, hooks, WP_Query, etc.


Finding existing libraries, plugins or other internal/external solutions to solve programming challenges, rather than reinventing the wheel


Deploying websites onto production hosts via git, rsync (and maybe sometimes sFTP), configuring caching, updating DNS records, and associated launch tasks


Quickly and effectively maintaining/troubleshooting/supporting code written by other developers


Command line tools like git, gulp, and wp-cli


JavaScript (particularly in jQuery)


Laughing at our stupid jokes (and the occasional good one)


Performing basic devops/Linux sysadmin tasks like writing bash scripts, configuring web or database servers, and figuring out why the Ã¢ÂÂuploads donÃ¢ÂÂt work!Ã¢ÂÂ


Troubleshooting MySQL performance issues (and writing performant queries)


Working in a fast-paced environment (we keep pretty busy!) and managing a workload of several projects at a time


Utilizing superb written and oral communication skills


ÃÂ 
Other stuff weÃ¢ÂÂd love it if youÃ¢ÂÂre good at, but arenÃ¢ÂÂt requirements:


Working with and customizing Buddy/bbPress and WooCommerce


Drafting functional requirements that specify the appropriate technologies, techniques and architectures necessary to bring needed features to life


Working with other developers to implement the aforementioned plans


Not losing your s#!% when you occasionally get feedback like Ã¢ÂÂNevermind. We actually need that field that we told you not to migrateÃ¢ÂÂ (and then getting asked to change it back), which may happen despite our best efforts 


Working with nonprofit CRM tools such as Salsa, Luminate Online, Engaging Networks, and Salesforce


Remembering to un-mute yourself before talking on conference calls


Being passionate about progressive causes


Writing custom CSS/SASS for cross-browser, responsive design (not just by using Bootstrap)


Configuring and/or maintaining AWS environments for hosting PHP-based websites and applications


Mucking around with Laravel


ÃÂ 
Cornershop Creative is an award-winning online services agency committed to listening carefully to our non-profit and small business clients and helping them achieve their goals. Our designs are beautiful, and our websites are creative and innovative. Learn more about us at https://cornershopcreative.com/.
ÃÂ 
To apply, send an email to jobs@cornershopcreative.com with the following:


Your rÃÂ©sumÃÂ©, which should include an indication of which American state you live and work in


A brief cover letter, explaining why youÃ¢ÂÂre excited about this opportunity


Links to work youÃ¢ÂÂve done that we should see, such as recent websites, git repos, or contributed plugins/modules/themes


Ideal hourly rate


ÃÂ 
U.S. Applicants only!
ÃÂ 
Please be sure to include all of these items Ã¢ÂÂ to save everyone valuable time weÃ¢ÂÂll throw out incomplete applications. Thanks for understanding.
ÃÂ 
ÃÂ 
Cornershop is an equal opportunity employer.
ÃÂ

name: Backend Web Developer (Laravel)_30381
description:
Who We Are
ScaleLab is a leading digital talent network on a mission to help online influencers expand their audience and overall career through technology and top-level agency services. We represent thousands of established social media stars and pride ourselves on providing each of them with the tools, support, community and resources they need to grow on and beyond the digital platforms theyÃ¢ÂÂve mastered. Developing cutting-edge technology that utilizes years of industry experience combined with the enormous amounts of data provided by our large client-base is the core of the future of our company. This is where you come in!
Who are we looking for
Are you a type of person who loves to dive into a new technology stack? Are you self-motivated to explore and embrace new trends, routines, and technology? Do you love to work in a small and productive team? 
We are looking for an experienced, LA-based Backend Engineer who will play a key role in ScaleLabÃ¢ÂÂs vision for an integrated experience for brands and influencers. You will be a part of a small engineering team improving on our current suite of products, as well as building a brand new product thatÃ¢ÂÂs meant to revolutionize the influencer marketing industry. ÃÂ 
Requirements
- 5+ years of back end development (PHP)
- Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills, motivation, and passion
- Expert level PHP with Laravel 5 framework
- Practical experience building and consuming RESTful APIs
- Strong knowledge of PHP 7, SOLID (object-oriented design), Object-relational mapping and LEMP stacks
- Experience in OOP (object oriented programming) & SOA (Service-oriented architecture)
- Strong MySQL knowledge (table design, complex query creation, best practices)
- Solid understanding of the full web technology stack (e.g. HTTP, cookies, asset loading, caching, REST)
- Experience writing unit and integration tests
- Experience using CI/CD tools and systems such as Jenkins, Hudson, GitLab, GitHub, etc.
- Experience with Symfony is a plus
- Experience with Docker is a plus
- Experience with Websockets is a plus
Responsibilities
- Design, develop, and maintain various backend APIs using Laravel and PHP7
- Write and maintain clean, well-written, test-driven PHP code and documentation conforming to standards
- Troubleshoot, identify and resolve API performance problems
- Optimize database schema, queries, and caching
- Collaborate with peers on best practices and promote knowledge sharing
- Release early, release often
ÃÂ

name: Blockchain company looking for Front-end Web UI/UX Developer who wants to change the world_30346
description:
Blockchain company looking for Front-end Web UI/UX DeveloperÃÂ who wants to change the world
ÃÂ 
About You

You live in San Diego, CA and do not need to be convinced that working in a fast-paced blockchain company out of our Hacker HQ in downtown San Diego is a badass opportunity.
You are an awesome Frontend Web UI/UX Developer
A master of JS, HTML, CSS, SASS, etc.
Comfortable with photoshop gulp, react, and brownie points for node.js
You make stunning subtle animations to sites possible
You are fine with fast-paced, startup environments (we are not necessarily a startup; we are a multimillion dollar blockchain and location technology company founded in 2012, but have the feel of a startup out of the show Silicon Valley)
The idea of building the "Aviato" of the blockchain world excites you.
You actually get that reference.
You're able to work fulltime
You are fine working in-personÃÂ 
You have significant experience developing front-end websites and apps
Brownie points if you are comfortable wearing the DevOps hat if needed to make sure AWS is set up to scale and run smoothly
You have experience with Bootstrap UI Framework and can also make badass JS/CSS animations (beautiful subtle stuff like: https://iota.org/)
You're familiar with Github best practices/workflowÃÂ 
You have experience with Amazon Web Services: EC2, S3 and CloudFront

About XYO
Visit https://www.xyo.network to have your mind blown.
The XYO Network is the world's first Proof of Location blockchain project with over 1 million Bluetooth and GPS devices in the world. Please visit https://www.xyo.network to learn more.ÃÂ 
The company behind XYO Network is XY Findables, which was started in 2012 and has produced over 1 million devices in the Bluetooth & GPS findables businesses (competing and becoming the premiere product even while competing against large-funded brands like Tile). Here is the corporate website of XY Findables (https://www.xyfindables.com/).
We are looking for a Senior Front-end Web Developer who can both manage our front-facing web properties and take them to the next level (sites like https://www.xyo.network) as well as someone who will then transition into developing our suite of web apps and tools.ÃÂ 
Next steps
If the above looks good to you, please apply and include answers to these:

Do you live near San Diego, and are you able to work in-person in our office in downtown San Diego?
When can you start?
Your work samples showcasing your work in creating beautiful sites with subtle animation (like: https://iota.org/); and anything else.
Resume
Do you consider yourself more of a front-end UI/UX developer or backend node.js type of programmer? (Please describe your experience and skill-level in web apps as well as web site UI/UX development.)
Your personal website, portfolio and/or Github profile
How comfortable are you with slicing photoshop files and converting to web?

ÃÂ

description:
About us:
Our motivation to create Fleetsmith stemmed from our deep frustration with existing computer management solutions. We knew we could do a lot better. Our product is powerful, yet incredibly easy-to-use. We bring the product and design focus traditionally only associated with consumer companies to the Ã¢ÂÂenterprise softwareÃ¢ÂÂ space. name: Business Development Sales Manager_30403
description:
Business Development Manager
Gravity, launched in 2004, as the creative division of PhototypeÃ¢ÂÂ¦one of the longest running, independently-owned brand-building companies in the US. Collectively, we employ over 275 brand leaders, strategists, designers, production artists, graphics application and workflow specialists, programmers, color scientists and printing experts in offices throughout the US, Europe and Asia. 
ÃÂ The Business Development Manager is responsible for expanding the creative business and portfolio by selling our core service offerings, either individually or via a bundled solution, to potential leads. The ideal candidate has a strong background and demonstrated experience in selling creative services in a B2C/B2B environment and is comfortable working with senior-level decision makers, up to and including the C-level in targeted businesses. Core service offerings are: Innovation, Brand Strategy, and Design. Reporting to the SVP of Sales and Marketing, the Business Development Manager is a partner to the Vice President, Executive Creative Director and Brand Development Director of Gravity; planning, presenting, and strategizing.
**Only candidates with previous branding and design experience will be considered**
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Creates networks and independently identifies targets and possible leads 
Develops, schedules and implements business development action plan 
Follows up on new leads and referrals resulting from lead-generating activity
Actively works towards achieving the revenue goals as established in partnership with the SVP of Sales and Marketing
Completes RFIÃ¢ÂÂs (Request for Information) and RFPÃ¢ÂÂs (Request for Proposal)
Represent company at business functions and participates in industry-related organizations
Works with Executive Creative Director on the development of sales and presentation materials 
Works collaboratively with Marketing to develop creative outreach strategies to attract potential prospects
Prepares for and attends exhibits, conferences, meetings, and other local, regional and national promotional and trade show opportunities
Works with the creative team on the initial integration of new business or initiative

ÃÂ Required Skills:
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Negotiation and persuasion skills while being diplomatic and tactful
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Ability to build and maintain productive relationships across the organization
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Strategic thinker-uses a consultative/relationship building sales approach
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Strong analytical, problem-solving, critical-thinking and innovative solution capabilities 
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Handles self with finesse and diplomacy with an understanding of changing priorities, sense of urgency, execution of results and support for the team
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Is an effective, mature, self-aware team player who has a calming style
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Leads and initiates change effectively and is flexible and collaborative in all cross-functional responsibilities
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Operates with high integrity, is productive under high pressure, hands-on when needed
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Demonstrates excellent communication ability using strong listening skills and logical, systematic approach to assimilating and sharing information in all areas 
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Strong knowledge of consumer products packaging, creative design, production artwork and print services helpful
Ideal Candidate Attributes:
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Has personality for and is comfortable with cold calling
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Pushes boundaries to uncover a clientÃ¢ÂÂs unmet business need
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Questions reality with his/her entrepreneurial spirit
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Ignites passion with an energetic personality
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Creates a better future for our clients and company
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Self-motivated and disciplined
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Effectively manages time
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Willing to constantly improve
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Openness and adaptability to change
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Strong problem-solver
ÃÂ·ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Able to prioritize and complete work assignments and projects in timely fashion
ÃÂ 
Experience:
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  10+ years business development experience selling creative services in a CPG setting
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Strong network of relationships with c-suite strongly desired
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Experience outside the CPG landscape a plus
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Working knowledge of techniques in: planning and scheduling, gathering data, development of quotes and proposal preparation; compiling information, preparing reports, and analyzing and solving problems
Ã¢ÂÂ¢ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ ÃÂ  Computer proficiency including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
ÃÂ 
In return for your talents, Gravity offers a dynamic work environment, competitive salaries, and full benefits effective your first day of employment including medical, dental, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability, as well as education reimbursement, 401k and profit sharing plans.
ÃÂ 
For fastest consideration, please apply online through the Careers section of www.phototype.com.ÃÂ ÃÂ  
No phone calls please.

name: Client Care Specialist_30374
description:
Do you have the ability to read into a question and really understand what someone is asking? Does Ã¢ÂÂmaking someone's day' get you out of bed in the morning? Do you want to work with a company that really makes a difference in the lives of others?
We are looking for a rockstar Client Care Specialist to join our team and provide superior customer service that exceeds our client's expectations.
What You'll be Doing
You get to work from home with an amazing team of Client Care Specialists that care deeply about building and strengthening our client relationships. You will educate clients on our products and respond to tough (and not-so-tough) inquiries through email using Desk.com and on live chat using Intercom.io. You will also make the occasional phone call. Yep, you'll be responding to LOTS of people and putting smiles on their faces all day. That takes a certain kind of person. If that's you...read on.
Our Ideal Candidate
Knows their stuff. This can't be your first rodeo. You have at least 2 years of experience in a web-based, service oriented company providing customer support where email and live chat were your primary responsibilities.
Can read between the lines.ÃÂ Sometimes a client's question isn't always obvious, and I'm sure you know, a lot can get lost in 'email' translation. A client may be asking for one thing, and really need something else. You have an uncanny ability to read into what they are looking for, ask the right questions, and exceed their expectations by responding to their real question.
Has great sleuthing skills. You are able to do your own detective work and find clues with the tools you have access to. You never pass on a case without first trying to piece the puzzle together.
Is an exceptional communicator. You know how to get your message across clearly and concisely to different audiences, through the written word. You are a skilled writer and have outstanding proofreading skills. Yup, you're a natural here.
Embraces sales.ÃÂ You understand that part of your role is to be a frontline salesperson and you see this as an important part of how you approach your work.
Cares.ÃÂ You are an empathetic advocate for our clients. You recognize that through email, you are building relationships, making our customers feel cared for, and quickly solving problems if an experience doesn't go 100% as planned. You care about our clients having accurate information and are getting their issues resolved.
Is thorough and obsessed with the details. You are careful, cautious, and incredibly meticulous; some may even call you nitpicky - in an endearing way, of course! And, you dream about dotting the i's and crossing the t's. Nothing slips by the net when you're goalie.
Is comfortable with frequent pivots.ÃÂ You have the ability to prioritize and re-prioritize your work in a fast-changing environment - you understand that things change as new information is made available. You don't mind shifting gears and are skilled at having a few balls up in the air at one time.
Is committed to their craft.ÃÂ You were meant to be in Client Care. It is your unique ability. It's not a stepping stone to join PN or to gain some experience to launch another career. You care about people and want to be sure they have everything they need to make the right decision for themselves and get their questions answered.
Has the ability to work independently and can ramp up quickly, for more intense periods of work.ÃÂ Once you are confident in what you need to do, you can run with it and don't need a lot of direction. That said, you are not on an island. You'll get plenty of help and support from the team when you need it and when it gets busy during launch periods and the team needs you - you'll jump right in.
Leaves their ego at the door.ÃÂ You have integrity, talent, are outgoing, have a palpable excitement about the future, and don't show it off. Shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, and excessive 'constructive criticism' are out.
Wants to be part of a purpose-driven organization.ÃÂ PN is a pretty incredible place and is committed to allowing you to do the work you love and love the work you do.
Life-changing, research-driven nutrition coaching. That's our mission at Precision Nutrition.
As an organization, we:

Seek and support diversity.
Offer 4 weeks paid time-off, benefits, and the ability to work remotely.
Set you up with whatever fancy gear you need to perform at your best.
Give you the flexibility to make your own schedule.

Not only that, but if you join us you can:

Work in the fitness and nutrition industry. We love exercise, we love nutrition, and we love sport. That's why we started this company. If you do too, you'll appreciate how rare it is to find a career you really love. For active, fit people, Precision Nutrition is that opportunity.
Work with fun, bright, and talented people. We're a small company, and we're picky about who we work with, because to us, this isn't just a job; it's our life.

If you or someone you know is interested in the position we welcome you to apply below. Please only apply if you are committed to the Client Care field. Only serious applicants will be considered and not those looking for an opportunity to get into PN.

name: Creative Director_30387
description:
About Us Ã¢ÂÂ Please allow us to introduce ourselves
Sir Kensington's is a food innovation company, best known for making condiments with character. We work to bring integrity and charm to ordinary and overlooked food. Beginning in 2010, we realized that while food was evolving, condiments weren't. So, we decided to make them better, starting with ketchup. Since then, we launched mayonnaise, mustard, and Fabanaise, and gained a cult following. Now, you can find our condiments in hundreds of leading restaurants, thousands of leading retailers, and millions of meal kit boxes across the country. But we're just getting started. We aim to be America's leading natural condiment brand, and we need your help.In April of 2017, Sir KensingtonÃ¢ÂÂs joined Unilever, the leading progressive global consumer products company. With them, we're part of a family of global brands helping to define the future of good food and good business. With access to Unilever's resources and expertise, we will continue to operate independently from our SoHo headquarters.
About the Role Ã¢ÂÂWhen you arenÃ¢ÂÂt eating this is what you will do...Sir KensingtonÃ¢ÂÂs is seeking a Creative Director to lead the refinement and expansion of our creative DNA. You will lead the evolution of our brandÃ¢ÂÂs visual identity, and the execution of all creative projects.
You will report to our CMO, working collaboratively with the Marketing and Communications teams to execute across all mediums (digital, print, experiential). YouÃ¢ÂÂll manage our graphic designer as well as creative agency partners to tackle a wide range of projects, from developing a new website (2018-19), to event branding, product launches, and digital campaigns.
Responsibilities:-Applying systems thinking to solve brand challenges. You understand that with over 50 products and growing, no decision can be made without understanding the implications for the entire system.-Leading the creative team as we work to evolve our brand. As Sir KensingtonÃ¢ÂÂs grows, youÃ¢ÂÂll help us find the best way to communicate our brand ethos and product attributes through visual design and packaging.ÃÂ -Collaborating heavily with marketing and communications. YouÃ¢ÂÂll lead the team for creating packaging, digital assets, social content, recipe content, apparel, and more.-Dreaming big while never losing sight of the details. YouÃ¢ÂÂll work on large-scale, strategic projects that influence multiple consumer touchpoints and require attention to detail and care.
This role is based in New York City.
About You Ã¢ÂÂ Necessary ingredients
The ideal candidate will bring your own skill and taste to the projects at hand. You are proactive in developing new and original ideas, love to problem-solve, have a deep understanding of brand, have a strong eye for typography, and are passionate about design and food.ÃÂ You also have:-An intimate understanding of design, content, and web best practices, including software and file set-up for a variety of production methods.ÃÂ -Experience in creative direction with a proven track record in generating new ideas and campaigns-The ability to create across a variety of mediums with a skill set in digital, print, and environmental / out-of-home design. -Experience managing a team and meeting deadlines while handling multiple projects at once and collaborating with others.-No ego when it comes to executing -- we have a small team, and everyone has to be both a thinker and a do-er.-Comfort giving feedback, navigating multiple points of view, and being able to make decisions as a creative leader.-An extremely high attention to detail.ÃÂ -5+ years of experience working in the field. -Love for food!
The Special Sauce Ã¢ÂÂ Figuratively speaking (though we also make special sauce)If you're looking for an entrepreneurial, fast-paced startup environment, you'll thrive at Sir Kensington's. But there's more to it than that. If youÃ¢ÂÂre naturally curious and seek to contribute at a purpose-driven food company, you'll feel at home here. We extend Sir Kensington's ethos of "integrity and charm" into the way we work.
-Opportunity to contribute at a fast growing and entrepreneurial company-All the condiments (with character) you can eat-A supportive environment which values profession development, personalresponsibility, and candor-Benefits include health insurance, 401(k), restaurant and wellness stipend,unlimited snacks, and more.
Sir KensingtonÃ¢ÂÂs Mission and Values
Our Mission:To bring integrity and charm to ordinary and overlooked food.
Our Values:1Ã¢ÂÂ Our secret ingredient is people.Our work is teamwork. We foster a supportive environment where our team works with a sense of purpose, potential, and play.2 Ã¢ÂÂ We act with honor, even when no one is looking.We take pride in our work, delivering on our own sense of potential at everyopportunity. Our workmanship is evidence of who we are.3 Ã¢ÂÂ We make condiments with character.Our products are the most tangible manifestation of our work. They are a?reflection of our unique philosophy and distinguished by what we call Ã¢ÂÂKensington Quality.Ã¢ÂÂ4 Ã¢ÂÂ We think long term??We move quickly, but are patient enough to make big things happen. In all parts?of our business, we build genuine, lasting relationships.
?Equal Opportunity EmploymentAs Sir KensingtonÃ¢ÂÂs first value states, our secret ingredient is people. We seek to recruit?and include people with a diversity of abilities, backgrounds, and cultures to better serve our diverse community of customers.
??Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Persons with Disabilities.
Applicants and employees are protected from discrimination under Federal law. For more information, please seeÃÂ EEO is the Law.
?If this sounds like a job for you, please email us at recruiting@sirkensingtons.com with the subject line Ã¢ÂÂGraphic Designer.Ã¢ÂÂ

description:

name: Ecommerce Product Manager_30357
description:
About the Role:
Best Made is seeking a Product Manager to lead and project manage our development road map and assist with site updates, strategy, and content. Reporting to the Senior Director of Growth Marketing, the Product Manager will be focused on enabling and supporting customer acquisition and retention efforts through the Best Made website and across the Growth Marketing team, while also ensuring core stability and functionality of our systems. Our mission over the next year is to build platforms that support scalable growth, with a scrappy team, and in a way that creates a delightful customer experience, drives revenue, and supports brand differentiation and growth.
This is a high-visibility role at a fast-growing, innovative brand that is the right fit for someone who can understand the end-to-end implications of feature development and who has superior collaboration skills across a wide variety of cross-functional partners and working styles. The role requires someone who is equally comfortable serving as a customer champion, a high-level strategist, a day-to-day project manager, and a coach/collaborator to partners who may be new to agile product development processes. The person in this role is equally adept at prioritizing and addressing bug fixes, diving into acceptance and testing criteria, as well as strategizing solutions for 6 months to a year from now.
The candidate will work closely with developers, UX designers, and Site Content and Merchandise managers to ensure that our solutions are a good fit for the right market and brand opportunity and support continuous testing and learning of features. You'll also help identify, evaluate, and/or establish key partnerships externally and internally to drive solution expansion as needed.
The ideal candidate is a master of prioritization and cross-functional collaboration, with strong communication and project management skills, a keen sense for end-to-end implications of developments, and a proven track record of getting things done. The ideal candidate is comfortable with data-driven decision making and is also comfortable translating data-driven recommendations for creative, customer or brand focused thinkers. He/she is able to influence and lead partners even when not in a position of direct authority, and loves to think big.
What YouÃ¢ÂÂll Do:

Collaborate with Developer and Design teams to identify feature requirements, testing and acceptance criteria, and create a development roadmap
Manage backlog of feature requirements, prioritizing features and communicating prioritization and timelines persuasively across teams and stakeholders
Develop customer-first oriented growth strategies and serves as a customer champion
Collaborate closely with Senior Marketing Manager, Site Content & Merchandising, to ensure the site has capabilities required to support brand and content initiatives as well as merchandising testing and learning
Support Planning, Merchandise, Service, and Store Retail in meeting business goals and needs, balancing internal business needs with technologies and customer needs and experience
Analyze test and site data to identify key customer pain points and opportunities for refinement, new solutions, and growth
Lead introduction of product development methodologies within the company and mentor/coach partners on processes and approaches
Support project management initiatives as needed

The Ideal Candidate Has:

5+ years of e-commerce product management
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
An entrepreneurial mentality; willingness to roll up the sleeves and do whatever is necessary to meet goals, and a passion for keeping up with innovations and trends in digital marketing and e-commerce
Keen analytical and quantitative skills, ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases, attention to detail
Strong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple competing priorities and create a sense of urgency in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Proven track record driving innovation on behalf of both enterprises and consumers with a keen ability to prioritize task and to communicate and explain prioritization to multiple stakeholders
Experience developing user stories and acceptance criteria and managing a backlog
Excellent customer intuition; demonstrated success in creating innovative and user-friendly web services and customer-facing features

Bonus Points For:

Experience with both e-commerce and physical retail transactions
Experience developing for mobile devices
Experience with Netsuite, Shopify Plus, or Solidus
Experience across both agile and waterfall development methods

Use the Word to HTML converter to avoid dirty code and messy markup when publishing documents online.

GreenBiz offers full health and dental benefits and a culture that is collaborative, hardworking, and fun. description:

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.
We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.

- WeÃ¢ÂÂll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. (http://x-team.com/unleash)

FAQ:
Who is X-Team meant for?
- Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.

Will I get a job immediately after applying?
- If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.

What kind of opportunities do you provide?
- We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.

name: Lead Developer (Python/PHP)_30348
description:
Lead Developer [PHP/Python]
Parklink Limited seeks a skilled, motivated candidate to fill the position of remote Lead Technician fluent in Python and PHP, who loves the challenges of high-availabilty SaaS and working with hardware.
About us
Parklink Development Limited provides RFID duplication devices to locksmiths and security professionals.
Our flagship product is 'Rebadge'. It's a patented machine that duplicates RFID badges for customers. Before Rebadge, it was impossible to duplicate consumer RFID badges. Since the launch of Rebadge, literally hundreds of thousands of people have been able to make copies of their badges, and the number increases every day.
Each machine is an embedded linux system running Python + Qt, and tethered online.Supporting the machines is a RESTful API (CakePHP).There is also a full back-office system for client management, machine management, billing, etc.
We've got over 2,000 machines online (Check out our coverage map here: https://rebadge.eu)
We've recently expanded into Australian and US markets. With this growth comes new challenges, and this is where your expertise comes in.
The team currently consists of three staff - the founding partners operating in the roles of CTO and COO, and a technical support role. The succesful candidate would be the fourth member on the team. The company structure is based in Hong Kong, but the partners are EU based.
We are a highly optimised / lean company. The successful candidate will have the ability to work autonomously on a constantly evolving product and rapidly expanding client base. You will work on a real product that is used by thousands of people daily.ÃÂ 
Working for us means you'll be able to flex your development muscles, and you'll have a real impact on a real product that exists in the real-world, used by thousands of people every day. It's an exciting possibility.
We are not another boring SaaS company. We create, manufacture and deploy real hardware on a global scale, with back and front end code managing it all. You'll have a chance to get your hands onto hardware, software, development and deployment. If you're driven, curious, and a hacker at heart, this position is for you.ÃÂ 
We will provide you with all the training and tools you need, an annual travel budget, and a dynamic, fair and respectful work environment.ÃÂ 
Reciprocatively, we are seeking to work with someone that is honest, skilled, self-motivated, and reliable.
Tasks:
As a lead technician, your tasks will be divided into two categories:

Backend Development (CakePHP)
Embedded Development (Python)

Backend Development
Our systems (API + Back-office) are based on the CakePHP framework, backed by a geographically Distributed High-Availability LAMP stack (Europe + Asia)
The RESTful API provides the interface to the network of machines, and the back office provides administration functionality for us and our clients.
Backend Development Tasks

Maintaining & Developing the API [PHP / CakePHP]
Maintaining & Developing the Administration Interface [PHP / CakePHP]
Maintaining & Optimisation of the Database [MySQL]

We have short, medium and long term goals, and milestones setup for our system. You're coming into a stable, clean, code base that we'll give you all necessary training on.
Our frameworks are under GitHub source control, with a CI environment for staging and production.
ÃÂ We will provide necessary development environments (VirtualBox environment).
Embedded DevelopmentÃÂ 
We have 2000+ networked machines deployed. Each machine is powered by a Raspberry Pi 3, with dual-frequency RFID readers and touch screen. We have a custom linux deployment running the client software, written in Python + Qt [Pyside]
The software is under clean, stable, and under active development.ÃÂ 
Embedded Development Tasks

Maintaining & Developing machine software [Python]
Developing / Deploying a Unit Testing framework [Python / FrogLogic Squish]
Development / Maintenance of System scripts / enviroment [Linux / Bash]

We will provide all necessary training + hardware required to get started on theÃÂ  systems.
Skill / Experience Requirements
Technical Skills

Python 3 [Fluent]

QT / PySide Experience Bonus
Ability to write, respect & maintain unit tests


PHP 5/6/7ÃÂ  [Fluent]

OOP (PSR-1 & 2) Obligatory
CakePHP Experience Bonus
Ability to write, respect & maintain unit tests (CodeCeption, PHPUnit)


Git/GitHub competancy

Fluent with Git, respecting & maintaining development procedures (issue branch, code review, pull request, merge, etc)


Database (Mysql)

Query optimisation for high load environments


High Traffic, High Availability ClustersÃÂ 

Experience with distributed server clusters and writing highly optimised code for high-load environments - understanding the requirements of high-load environments


Linux Familiarity

Intermediate configuration & administration tasks (SSH, Bash, etc)
Rasbian Experience Bonus


Hardware Familiarity

Raspberry PI
Serial / UART


NFC FamiliarityÃÂ [Bonus]

13.56 (Mifare, libNFC, etc)
125KHz (T55, EM4XX etc)ÃÂ 



Personal Skills

English (Fluency in written + spoken)
Ability to communicate clearly and efficiently
Ability to work autonomously & self-motivate
Ability to integrate into an existing team & structure

Time Requirements

This is a full time, remote position (8 hours per day, 5 days per week)
Reachable during work hours via phone / slack

Compensation

40000EU per year / ~$50,000 USD
2kEU Hardware Allowance / $2450 USD
Annual Travel Allowance
We will provide all training required
We will provide all hardware necessary (Devices, parts, badges, etc)
Flexible time off: 25 Paid Vacation days + 11 Paid Public Holidays

Application Pre-requisites

Your updated CV
A brief email explaining who you are, why you fit the position, and how your experience is relevant.
A link to your GitHub/GitLab account
An overview of your side projects that you work on / contribute to.

We will take time to study each application with diligence - please take the time to read over the position requirements carefully.

name: Product Designer_30333
description:
DESCRIPTION
Flocabulary is a rapidly growing edtech company that uses music to drive student achievement and foster a love of learning. Students in more than 20,000 schools use our rap songs and interactive learning tools to master academic content. Our product and work reflect our strong belief that a motivated student is a successful student.
The Product Designer will report to our Design Lead. As the third designer to join our growing team, you will have the autonomy to work on important features that shape our product, visual brand and the education of many students. YouÃ¢ÂÂre empathetic toward your teammates and in your approach to design. You can zoom out to understand the context, the user story, and the Ã¢ÂÂwhyÃ¢ÂÂ. name: Product Designer_30371
description:
Common Networks
Company
Common Networks was founded on the idea that everyone should have a choice for fast, affordabe access to broadband internet. Right now, most homes in the U.S. don't, in fact 62% of homes live in a monopoly broadband market. High-speed access unlocks all the superpowers on the internet. When it works, it can be a great leveling force across the world, giving everyone access to educational tools, entertainment, immediate translations, or even medical care that they wouldn't otherwise have.
Common Networks provides surburban neighborhoods with internet using wireless technology. We interconnect homes in a neighborhood, creating a mesh network between homes and our fiber internet sources. A whole community can then have fast and reliable internet service with only a fewÃÂ  locations needing fiber access.
Role
We are looking to hire our first Product Designer. The primary function of this role is UX/UI design, but this role will also be flexible to do some visual design and marketing design. As the first designer, you will have heavy influence over our overall brand and product experience. We are seeking a designer who can use design thinking, product design, and visual design to help achieve our company-level goals. We care deeply about our customer experience and believe that crafting and honing this experience is what sets us apart from the incumbent ISPs that exist today.
What you do

Problem-solve with the product and engineering teams to come up with solutions for problems/challenges across our entire platform
Build designs for products and features for a number of different audiences: internal users, field technicians, and our internet subscribers
Work cross-functionally with engineers, field operations team, and product managers to implement features
You are the voice of design at the company and help to hold us to a high bar of design excellence

Who you areÃÂ 

You care first and foremost about creating an awesome user experience, no matter who the customer is. To that end, you know how to balance aesthetics, functionality and practicality.
Design generalist. Your strength is in UX/UI design, however you can also produce visual designs, build marketing templates, and help us think through industrial design of our hardware.
Collaborative team member.ÃÂ  You are open, honest, and can respectfully work through difficult problems with the rest of the team.
Clear communicator. You have many audiences - engineers, designers, operations team, our board of directores, etc. You know how to structure written and verbal communications clearly for each audience.
Creative problem-solver. We are developing technology and a product that has never been built before. You are creative; you generate new, innovative ideas that help us solve problems.
Detail oriented. You sweat the small stuff and don't let things slip through the cracks. You understand the difference between letting something slip through the cracks vs. actively deprioritizing an edge case.
Naturally curious and have a self-starter personality with hustle. You don't need to wait for people to tell you what to work on. You know that done is better than perfect and are engergized by constantly delivering and moving things forward. You roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to make things successful.

name: Product Designers at multiple levels_30321
description:
Every day, millions of people rely on WeTransfer to share their creative ideas. So, the work we do matters. Come and be a part of it.
Our approach to design
WeTransfer aims to build simple tools around peopleÃ¢ÂÂs creative process, on any device. WeÃ¢ÂÂre interested in the weird and wonderful ways that creative minds work, and how they shape the world around us. This thinking has made our products and brand loved by anyone Ã¢ÂÂ from our moms to your favorite artists. As we grow, the simplicity of our service will be challenged. It is our responsibility to design and deliver delightful experiences that continue to feel obvious and intuitive to millions of people every day.
What youÃ¢ÂÂll be doing
As a product designer, you will work side-by-side with engineers and a product manager in a product team. Teams work autonomously, owning their part of the experience. YouÃ¢ÂÂll be responsible for the design of that experience and act as a creative and strategic partner for your teammates. This work is supported by a range of specialists to make sure design decisions are well-informed and that you have everything needed to take WeTransfer to the next level.
Product design at WeTransfer spans from subtle tweaks that make a difference, to innovation projects that define our productsÃ¢ÂÂ future. YouÃ¢ÂÂll work to improve, expand on and push the WeTransfer experience forward; designing elegant flows and interactions, testing solutions with prototypes, iterating to reach product objectives, maintaining our design system Ã¢ÂÂ all across web, mobile and desktop applications, and through product integrations. Every week youÃ¢ÂÂll get together with a group of designers to present and review work.
We take pride in building tools that enable creativity to flow. This has shaped the experience weÃ¢ÂÂve built, the way we work, and how we view our organization. Through our monthly Innovation Fridays, anyone in the company can work together to explore that outlook and whatÃ¢ÂÂs next for WeTransfer.
Qualities weÃ¢ÂÂll be looking for

We value smarts and an inquisitive attitude. YouÃ¢ÂÂll deal with quite a bit of complexity, and should be comfortable with ambiguity and abstraction.
WeTransfer is part of the creative community and so are you Ã¢ÂÂ broadly interested in tech, culture, and the arts.
You love to learn, unlearn, and relearn. In this rapidly changing world, itÃ¢ÂÂs imperative to keep evolving. You are an experienced designer, with a relevant education and some (or many) years on the ground.
You demonstrate a product mindset. Shipping product is key, that means youÃ¢ÂÂre happy to experiment and prototype, eager to talk to users, quick to sketch out ideas and you know how to get your design through development.
You articulate your ideas effectively through your verbal and written communication skills. Proficiency in the English language is required.
Our products are used by all kinds of amazing people, from all over the world. We actively look to have this diversity reflected in our teams.
Our product teams work from our Amsterdam office. You should either live within a commutable distance, or willing to relocate (we'll help you make the move, some conditions apply for visa applications).
We are growing rapidly and looking to fill several positions at multiple levels. WeÃ¢ÂÂd love for you to get in touch if youÃ¢ÂÂre ready for the next step in your career, working with an amazing team to create meaningful products for millions of people every day. ÃÂ°ÃÂÃÂÃÂ

We believe a diverse company is a better company. Whatever your story, we want to hear from you. Whatever your background, weÃ¢ÂÂll help you do your best work.ÃÂ

name: QA Manager_30389
description:
About Us
Guardhat is more than just a dynamic industrial wearable company - it is leading the charge in industrial safety. Using IoT technologies, Guardhat creates cutting-edge products designed to protect and empower industrial workers globally.
Guardhat is an industrial wearable that blends existing and emerging technologies to protect and empower industrial workers. About the role

description:
About X-Team

X-Team is an international company founded in Melbourne, Australia that helps companies scale their development teams by providing them with extraordinary developers from around the world.
We are 100% remote and believe in building a world where developers can have access to an environment of growth and incredible opportunities regardless of where they live. Our culture is based around the proactive, selfless values that make up every X-Teamer.

- WeÃ¢ÂÂll provide up to $2,500 in funding for your learning and growth through our Unleash program, which provides opportunities to unleash your potential through initiatives that help you grow as a developer and explore your passions more each day. (http://x-team.com/unleash)
ÃÂ 
FAQ:
Who is X-Team meant for?
- Any freelance developers with experience working on high-scale, remote teams and projects with a motivated, proactive attitude and compassionate, team-player heart. If you've worked with freelancing platforms before, that's not what we are. X-Team is a community of all likeminded people, carefully chosen to ensure we are able to create an environment of the most motivated people in the world who come together to unleash their potential. What we've created is truly special and not a faceless platform. X-Team is where developers go to feel truly at home together, while becoming more motivated than they've ever been.
ÃÂ 
What are you hiring for right now?
- We are hiring for Java developers to fill some exciting new opportunities we have. We're also hiring for a variety of other skills, such as PHP, React, React Native, Cryptocurrency/blockchain, Node.js, Salesforce, DevOps, and Golang.
ÃÂ 
Will I get a job immediately after applying?
- If your skills, experience and values align with a current opening we have, your chances of getting hired immediately are high. If we discover you're qualified but all opportunities have been taken, we'll continue to work with you to help you get a role in X-Team. The key is having the most relevant, in-demand skills when you apply.
ÃÂ 
What kind of opportunities do you provide?
- We provide full-time opportunities that last, on average, for 10 months. After your role ends (and so long as you've performed well), we continue to give you work internally with us until we find you a new opportunity. This ensures that X-Team can be a stable work option for you as a freelancer.
ÃÂ

name: Senior Product Designer_30405
description:
The Atlantic is looking for someone to join our product design team which focuses on the user experience, interactions, and UI for our digital products. The ideal candidateÃ¢ÂÂs experience is rooted in established design principles, and champions best practices and industry standards. You will need to know when to apply established patterns and styles, as well as when to evolve them. You will identify and help correct product inconsistencies, on both the visual and experience sides. Most importantly, you will create beautiful and usable interfaces that help our editorial team tell their stories.
What you will do

Work on the entire lifecycle of the product: research, prototyping, high fidelity comps, and collaborate with engineers on implementation.
Collaborate with product managers, developers, editors and other designers.
Help us evolve and expand our design system, affectionately called Hippo.
Balance the needs of the editorial team, the business, and the user.
Work on both customer facing interfaces as well as internal tooling.
Contribute to the growth of your junior colleagues by providing feedback, leading critiques, and elevating the output of the team.
Identify opportunities for improvement in our products and process and take the initiative to provide solutions.

What we are looking for

You have 5+ years of relevant experience
YouÃ¢ÂÂve designed and shipped mobile and web products. Experience specific to media or publishing is a plus.
You enjoy both details of the craft and deliberate, long-term systems thinking. You enjoy perfecting typography just as much as creating a component library.
Demonstrate and articulate an understanding of layout, typography and visual hierarchy, coupled with user centered design and best practices.
Software expertise with Sketch, Illustrator, and Photoshop. Experience using wireframe and prototyping tools, such as Invision, Omnigraffle, Framer, or Principle. A solid understanding of HTML and CSS. Coding experience is a plus.
Excellent communication and writing skills: can brainstorm with a group, articulate ideas, and tease out feedback from colleagues.
Enthusiasm for The Atlantic and a desire to contribute to the growth of our design culture.

ÃÂ 
To Apply
Candidates must apply with a link to an online portfolio that shows 5+ examples of product design. Candidates without an online portfolio or web-specific examples will not be considered.
ÃÂ 
About The Atlantic Product Team
The Product team is a relatively small, friendly bunch of folks, including the SVP and general manager of TheAtlantic.com, product directors and managers, platform and front-end engineers, and the product design team. We work closely together, meet frequently and promote discussions that encourage new ideas and critical thinking. We have bagels on Thursdays and drinks on Fridays.
ÃÂ 
Atlantic Media Values:Across Atlantic Media, generally, the firm looks for two Ã¢ÂÂpillar giftsÃ¢ÂÂ in you, and everyone else. ÃÂ In all of us, these are more aspirational than actual, but they are central in our intentions Ã¢ÂÂ
Force of Ideas:ÃÂ  At the center of Atlantic Media work are the ideas within our writing.ÃÂ  We believe that ideas Ã¢ÂÂ to the good and not Ã¢ÂÂ have consequence.ÃÂ  Our highest work is bringing rigor, insight, intellectual honesty, to that ultimate purpose of separating the bad from the good, and giving voice to the latter.Spirit of Generosity:ÃÂ ÃÂ Atlantic Media seeks in its ranks a spirit of generosity Ã¢ÂÂ a natural disposition in each colleague toward service and selfless conduct.ÃÂ  Atlantic Media writing should be cut from the same cloth Ã¢ÂÂcritical on the merits but informed by charity and forbearance in measuring motive and personal character.
Atlantic Media is an EOE of Minorities/Women/Vets/Disability.

name: Senior Software Engineer JavaScript_30343
description:
Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and thoughtfully consider if we would be a good fit for one another. This is a full-time position. You must be located in the continental U.S. No contractors or agencies. Seriously.
Why We Started Very
Not to oversimplify things, but our mission is to become the best IoT, blockchain, and machine learning product development shop in the world. We do this by hiring the best and investing heavily in them, both personally and professionally.
We Fully Embrace Working Remotely
About 30% of our team works out of our HQ in Chattanooga, TN, and the other 70% work remotely from various locations across the United States. We consider ourselves best-practitioners of the remote-first movement and believe a great team shouldnÃ¢ÂÂt be restricted by geography.
What YouÃ¢ÂÂll Be Working On
Very is first and foremost a software consultancy, we tackle hard problems for clients who need a targeted, senior team to come in and provide specific solutions. We are focusing heavily on building out products that have applications in one of the three following areas: 1) data science & machine learning, 2) Internet of Things, and 3) blockchain. WeÃ¢ÂÂve found that in each of these areas, the use of the underlying technology will drive the development of the core services , but that 75% of the work often still lives in the realm of modern web development.
At Very, there is a never ending supply of variety to the types of projects we work on. In the last year weÃ¢ÂÂve built solutions that touch e-commerce, trust management (finance), beer distribution, point of sale systems, ICOÃ¢ÂÂs, identifying fake news, and much more.
YouÃ¢ÂÂll spend 80% of your week (Monday through Thursday) designing and building a product or platform for one of our clients. The other 20% of your week (Friday) will be spent contributing to our open source projects, internal products, learning, teaching, and participating in internal operations of all flavors.
Project teams are small and usually made up of one or two pairs of engineers, a UX engineer, a product manager, and the client who serves as the product owner. We spend most of our time building new products, with the goal of helping our clients take it to market. We are often further engaged by our clients to continue iterating on the product once it is live. The high cost of context switching is real, so we do our best to keep teams together throughout the duration of their projects (typically 3-6 months), but have found it valuable to rotate pairing partners when it makes reasonable sense.
We are always exploring new tools, languages, and technologies. We feel strongly that itÃ¢ÂÂs a good idea to use the best tool for the job and not see everything as a nail. We also try our best to standardize our technology and tooling across project teams so itÃ¢ÂÂs easier to rotate and practice collective code ownership. We are currently building products and platforms using the following tools / platforms:


React & React Native


Swift & Objective C


Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves


Arduino (embedded C/C++)


Ethereum / Solidity


Ruby on Rails


Python


Pandas


Serverless


AWS (and a dash of Heroku where it makes sense)


Given that we work on quite a bit of greenfield projects, there is often room to experiment with new patterns and tools (within reason). We donÃ¢ÂÂt expect applicants to know our entire toolchain, but rather to be capable, flexible, and self-directed.
This Role: Senior Software Engineer // Javascript
Over the past few years, weÃ¢ÂÂve seen client-side engineering emerge as its own discipline, and we are looking for individuals who thrive in the front end and want to further their practice. Ideal candidates not only have a solid engineering background, but a passion for client-side development as well.
We value well-tested, reusable code and expect our engineers to be as good of practitioners as they are leaders and teachers.
How We Operate
We are believers in transparency and openness. In terms of organizational structure and governance, we are a holacracy. ItÃ¢ÂÂs worked pretty well for the us the last few years. When it comes to development processes, we do our best to adhere as closely to Extreme Programming as possible. We believe in hiring capable, responsible professionals. We donÃ¢ÂÂt micromanage and trust everyone to work hard, experiment, learn from their mistakes, and contribute to each other and the company in a sustainable manner. We have no venture funding or external investors, which affords us the ability to be nimble and run our company in the best interest of our team as a whole.
How YouÃ¢ÂÂll Be Compensated
We believe in a transparent, fair compensation structure and have developed our own open salary formula. Depending on your skill and experience, you can expect to make somewhere between $80,000 and $135,000 upon joining the company. We have many health plans available through UHCÃ¢ÂÂprices and plans vary based on your regionÃ¢ÂÂas well as vision and dental. We currently contribute a large portion to each plan, again, amounts vary based on region. As an added benefit, Very provides 1X Earnings Basic Life & AD&D. We have a 401k program that weÃ¢ÂÂll provide a 2% match on after a few months working with us. Lastly, 35% of the companyÃ¢ÂÂs ownership is reserved for a team member options pool.
ÃÂ

name: Senior UX Designer_30331
description:
Job Description
Position Overview:
We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Senior User Experience Designer to join our growing team based out of our New York City office.
Working closely with other team members, you will design and implement high quality, polished graphics, interfaces, and promotional materials for both front-facing and backend web sites, advertisements, and external mobile applications.
You will work closely with the Founder, Head of Product, and Head of Marketing.
Responsibilities:

Build great user experiences for mobile (native and web), desktop for consumer facing products
Design modern web interfaces (multiple breakpoints)
Develop graphics from concept through to completion (and measurement)
Create and/or apply brand identity standards across media
Create compelling visual designs used in multi-faceted marketing campaigns

Skills & Experience:

3-5 years of experience with digital and graphic design for web and mobile
Ability to create content from scratch using current assets
Ability to create mobile layouts and app interfaces for iOS and Android
Experience with responsive web design and a solid understanding of user-centered design required
Technical expertise in the development of design, prototyping and motion
Strong layout, color and typography skills
Strong working knowledge of Sketch, Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, and/or associated design tools (Zeplin, Invision, etc.)
Strong HTML/CSS with some Javascript nice to have
Experience working with engineers and providing full specs, fonts, etc

Personal Qualities:

Strong interpersonal skills, highly motivated, enthusiastic and dynamic with the ability to work effectively in a team
You obsess over details and your work is pixel-perfect
Strong oral and written communication
Passion for the craft and love of technology and a self-starter

Additional Requirements:

Must be in the NYC area.
Must be eligible to work in the US immediately.

About Masterworks
Masterworks allows you to invest in great masterpieces.
Similar to investing in the stock market, we allow you to invest and trade in great artworks by 20th century masters like Picasso, Monet, Warhol, and more.
Masterworks was founded in 2017 by technology and art-world entrepreneurs, who have over 100 years of combined experience in both industries. It is the first company to offer registered securities in great works of art, allowing investors to buy and trade in specific paintings valued above $10 million each.

name: Software Developer_30373
description:
Do you get excited about scaling, securing, and maintaining systems, so that our clients and our team have the tools they need, when they need them? Does troubleshooting, tinkering, and designing solutions to improve and monitor performance get you out of bed in the morning? Do you love to develop new features and build new products for a growing organization that makes a difference in peopleÃ¢ÂÂs lives? Precision Nutrition is looking for an experienced developer who doesnÃ¢ÂÂt just have a passion for building killer features, but also cares about maintaining and improving the overall health of our platform and infrastructure.
Who You Are
You balance the demands of product development, with the need to scale our growing user base. You can work anywhere in the stack: you mess with javascript for breakfast, write a new RESTful API endpoint in Rails for a mid-morning snack, tune a query in Postgres for lunch, and write an Ansible cookbook for dinner. You share our belief that every developer takes ownership of our production environment and isnÃ¢ÂÂt above operations work.
We know this is a tall order and requires a special person to do it right. If this sounds intriguing to you, read on.
What You Get to Do
Ruby/Rails API development. Our coaching platform is backed by a RESTful API implemented in Rails. YouÃ¢ÂÂll spend a lot of your time building, testing, and working with Rails. WeÃ¢ÂÂre using Elixir and Phoenix too, so come prepared to learn!
Ember. Our front-end devs are focused on working with our suite of Ember, user-facing applications - but it really helps if you can see the big picture and understand our stack front to back. That means learning Ember.js and Ember Data. DonÃ¢ÂÂt worry - youÃ¢ÂÂll have lots of help. WeÃ¢ÂÂve got a team of Ember experts to show you the ropes.
DevOps. YouÃ¢ÂÂll write reliable, scripted means of deploying code and system changes (today we use Ansible, yet weÃ¢ÂÂre open to trying new tools). YouÃ¢ÂÂll maintain provisioning and continuous integration systems, keep system software up to date, and ensure code can be deployed and rolled back easily and reliably, while making sure backups are behaving, and security best practices are being followed.
Monitor performance.YouÃ¢ÂÂll design and execute performance tests on our website and other applications, as well as recommend and implement system and application performance best practices.
Maintain our systems. YouÃ¢ÂÂll monitor the health of all systems, participate in our on-call rotation team, and respond to, and escalate infrastructure issues. YouÃ¢ÂÂll perform regular and ad hoc sysadmin tasks on all shared systems, and manage Amazon Web Services and other hosting service providers. YouÃ¢ÂÂll schedule and manage site downtime, and work with the team to proactively add infrastructure so that our clients and team have the best experience possible.
Our Ideal Candidate
Is experienced. You have at least 5 years of experience in a Development or DevOps role in an Agile environment. You know, or are excited to learn, Ruby on Rails, Ember, and maybe even some Elixir/Phoenix, as well as the usual tools of the trade: Amazon Web Services such as EC2, S3 and RDS, Ansible, Vagrant, Linux, PostgreSQL, Continuous Integration, and Redis.
Is on the cutting edge. In your spare time, you research and stay up to date on the latest and greatest best practices, systems, and tools.
Likes variety. You'll be wrangling all kinds of systems, apps, and technologies - everything from our Wordpress-based sales sites to our modern Ember/Rails based coaching platform and our next generation Elixir based payment processing system.
Can easily switch gears. You have the ability to prioritize and re-prioritize your work in a changing environment - you understand that things change as new information is made available. You donÃ¢ÂÂt mind managing multiple projects and have the ability to have a few balls up in the air at one time.
Cares. You take care of our data and systems like they are your very own.
Is self-motivated and can work independently. Once you are confident in what you need to do, you can run with it and donÃ¢ÂÂt need a lot of direction. You are highly organized and always eager to learn more and share with the team.
Leaves their ego at the door. You have integrity, talent, are outgoing, have a palpable excitement about the future, and donÃ¢ÂÂt show it off. Shadiness, mediocrity, cynicism, and excessive "constructive criticism" are out.
Is resilient and has a growth mindset. Part of open, honest communication is having the ability to deliver honest, direct feedback without being offensive or critical. The other part is having the ability to view honest, direct feedback as a gift you can use to get better. If youÃ¢ÂÂre married to your ideas or are (even mildly) offended when theyÃ¢ÂÂre challenged, this probably wonÃ¢ÂÂt be a good fit for you.
Has worked remotely. You have strong self-structure and discipline and have worked remotely either currently or in the past so you know the benefits and the challenges.
Wants to be part of a purpose-driven organization.ÃÂ PN is a pretty incredible place and is committed to allowing you to do the work you love and love the work you do.
Life-changing, research-driven nutrition coaching. That's our mission at Precision Nutrition.
As an organization, we:

Seek and support diversity.
Offer 4 weeks paid time-off, benefits, and the ability to work remotely.
Set you up with whatever fancy gear you need to perform at your best.
Give you the flexibility to make your own schedule.

Not only that, but if you join us you can:
Work in the fitness and nutrition industry.  We love exercise, we love nutrition, and we love sport. ThatÃ¢ÂÂs why we started this company. If you do too, youÃ¢ÂÂll appreciate how rare it is to find a career you really love. For active, fit people, Precision Nutrition is that opportunity.
Work with fun, bright, and talented people. WeÃ¢ÂÂre a small company, and weÃ¢ÂÂre picky about who we work with, because to us, this isnÃ¢ÂÂt just a job; itÃ¢ÂÂs our life.
If you or someone you know is interested please apply below.
