name: Software Engineer_30318
description:
About Us:
As the WorldÃ¢ÂÂs Largest Pool League, American Poolplayers Association (APA) has a unique business model that brings the people who are passionate about pool together with those who want to be social and have fun into a perfect mix of sports-themed entertainment. Only under our exceptional system can people from all backgrounds and skill levels, from total beginner to semi-professional, compete in the game of pool and have fun.
Our officesÃÂ are located in Lake Saint Louis, MO, right on the lake. We have a very relaxed atmosphere to work inÃÂ and weÃÂ believe in a healthy work/life balance. APA is a family owned and operated business and the sense of family is very strong given that the average tenure of our employees is 10+ years.
About the Position:
While the APA hasÃÂ used technology for decades, our in-house development team is just a couple of years old and weÃ¢ÂÂre growing it slowly and methodically to ensure proper fit of everyone we ask to join our team. We have a mix of legacy(VB.Net/SOAP) and modern(C#/WebAPI, React/GraphQL/Meteor/Node.js) applications that need support and enhancement as well as a backlog of new applications that need to be built.
We are looking for full-stack or front-end developers who want to build modern, web based, mobile friendly apps that will enhance our customer experience and bring a modern and tech-savvy edge to the pool league industry. We are pushing the envelope for what our industry has seen in regard to customer experience and service. This position is for someone more skilled in Javascript (Node/Angular/React/Meteor) than .Net languages. Our tech teamÃÂ gets to choose theÃÂ stack soÃÂ open source languages such Ruby, Go, Erlang are a possibility for the right task.
The technologies we use:


Node.js, React, Meteor, GraphQL(Apollo)ÃÂ Ã¢ÂÂ This is what we're hiring for

ASP VB.Net (legacy apps being supported while we retire them)
VB.Net Soap Services (legacy SOA tier being supported while we retire them)
C# WebAPI using EF, StructureMap (New Restful API)
SQL Server, Redis and Memcached (Data storage and caching)
Anything new that looks cool, sexy and can solve a need

Examples of existing projects and opportunities include:

Data-rich/responsive website for our customers with stats, schedules, standings, player profiles and social-media driven content
Opportunities to learn and use platforms like React/Node.js, Cordova/PhoneGap and XCode/Swift to develop and deliver mobile apps
Custom solutions for our International Tournaments held in Las Vegas (The WorldÃ¢ÂÂs Largest according to Guinness World Records)
Electronic scoring and payment systems to take full advantage of the mobile-revolution
Work together with our back-end team to help add value to the support of our existing projects and make them shine

Key Responsibilities:

Have fun and work hard
Work closely with in-house team of Creative and Operational leaders to craft solutions and bring amazing ideas to fruition
Solve problems and deliver solutions with speed and grace
Be a team player and work on whatever project needs you (We are a small team where egos are not tolerated)

About You:
You've been a software developer for a handful of years but what's really important to us is what you've learned and what you've done. You are aware of what you know and don't know, but that doesn't stop you from tackling the hard problems with great enthusiasm, actually the more impossible the task, the more determined you are to find a solution. However, you understand when to call for help, when to ditch an idea and pivot to something different. You know when to push back on a requirement and ask for more clarity. You stay current on tech. You love what you do and are passionate about creating great software (or at least you dream of being on a team that wants you to do so). You may have a Comp Sci degree, but you may just have stumbled into software development and found that you had a knack for it. You know your craft and you may have even squealed a little inside when the word "craft" was used to describe software development. You have worked on an Agile Development team before and understand Sprints, User Stories, and Story Point estimation. If not, you just googled "Agile Development" to learn more because that's just who you are.ÃÂ 
You have experience with some of the following (listed in order of importance):

Building applications with React or a similar Javascript framework
Bootstrap, HTML5, CSS3 and LESS, SASS, JCSS, etc.
Responsive web development experience - CSS media queries and JavaScript device detection
Production application experience with Cordova (we currently use Meteor and it's Cordova integration) and/or Electron
Working knowledge of Version Control such as Git or Mercurial
Experience with VB.Net, C#, MVC and/or ASP.Net (our API is C# WebAPI and legacy apps are in VB.Net)
Knowledgeable in Google Analytics/Google Tag Manager/Google Webmaster Tools a plus
Knowledgeable in WordPress/PHP a plus

Perks of working for APA:

You get your choice of computing hardware (Mac, PC, Laptop or Desktop, the choice is yours) and two or three massive 27" monitors to go with it
We close our offices between Christmas and New Years
401k with a healthy company match (after 1 year)
Competitive health insurance options (after 90 days)
We have a flexible work from home accommodation for our St. Louis based employees
Paid time off

name: Software Engineer_30411
description:
About Us
TradeTapp is an early stage startup whose focus is on using technology and financial analysis to help the construction management industry make better decisions.ÃÂ  Our product is a SaaS platform that assists general contractors in collecting, analyzing, and vetting the companies they hire to do the actual building.ÃÂ  We were founded in early 2016 by a construction industry expert along with two software developers.ÃÂ  Since launching, TradeTapp has already been adopted by some of the leading construction firms in the country,ÃÂ and is showing opportunity for significant future growth.
As we expand our development team, we are looking for software engineers interested in getting in at the ground floor, building upon our culture, and being part of this exciting phase of growth. This position will work closely with the founding team to advance our platform, lead in development of new features, and further shape the product for long term success.
Responsibilities
Being such an early startup, we can give you the opportunity to concentrate on the front-end, back-end, or a bit of both. ÃÂ 


Front End: ÃÂ Building and updating features in Angular.ÃÂ  We are currently an AngularJS/Angular hybrid app looking to convert fully to Angular.ÃÂ  You would be working very closely with out design team to continuously push out features.


End Backend: The core of our backend is a Django/Python REST API built on PostgreSQL.ÃÂ  Here youÃ¢ÂÂd be adding to and optimizing our endpoints, managing our data model, and updating our financial model and risk engine.


Beyond the technical responsibility, we are looking for someone who has a founders mentality, because that's exactly what first employees are.ÃÂ  Whether thatÃ¢ÂÂs developing best practices or finding better ways to communicate between our various teams, we need people who will help us be the best at turning an idea into something we can deliver to our clients.
Skills & Qualifications


Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent experience


Willing to take ownership and challenge how things are done in a team environment


Good understanding and interest of UI and UX design - passsionate about the details!


Be extremely self-motivated


Desire to be in a startup/early stage company where the pace is fast and you can be an integral part of our growth


Location & Benefits


We intend to open a New York City office in the very near future so an NYC based Engineer is preferred, however, this position can be filled remote.


Willingness to work from home or shared communal space on a interim basis


Unlimited vacation (you should have a life, just get your work done)


Flexible hours


Core Technologies:


Javascript/AngularJS/Angular(5)


Python/Django


SQL/PostgreSQL


HTML


REST API


Heroku


SASS

name: Solutions Architect_30421
description:
meltmedia is seeking a Solutions Architect to help us continue to deliver exceptional, web-based, technical solutions to our clients' problems. In addition to making our clients' lives easier through technology, you will also be highly involved in continuously improving the technical strategy of our various lines of business and helpÃÂ shape the overall technical strategy for the organization.
Your day in the life will be varied. You will work with our business development team to outline viable solutions for potential clients. You will work with established cross-discipline teams as they take your visions and make them their own, while ensuring the deliverables ultimately solve the clients' problems. You will also be expected to share your knowledge with your teammates, mentoring others through the challenges you have previously faced.
The right candidate will have extensive experience in the trenches, developing custom software solutions for clients. You will be an expert translator, from the clients' high level visions, into low-level technical details, and back. You are the type of person who has a strong desire to sit face-to-face with the client to understand their pain, while also needing to write some code from time-to-time. You understand there are often simple technical solutions to what may seem like unsurmountable problems to our clients. You thrive on making people's lives easier.
We are a cloud-first shop. You will have extensive knowledge in the full AWS stack. Ideally youÃ¢ÂÂve even jumped through the hoops of being officially certified as an AWS Solutions Architect. Our solutions vary based on the needs of our clients. We tend to develop custom solutions around our clients existing investments in products such as Adobe Experience Manager, Drupal 8, Veeva, Salesforce, and Pardot.ÃÂ  Any experience with these platforms would be highly beneficial.
Our custom solutions are a polyglot approach that may use Java, client and server-side JavaScript, Python, and PHP, depending on the needs of each project. We donÃ¢ÂÂt believe in having a client spend more money than necessary, therefore we prefer Ã¢ÂÂserverlessÃ¢ÂÂ solutions when appropriate.
As a Solutions Architect, there will be ample opportunity to introduce new and better technology, techniques, and solutions that grow our expertise and ultimately provideÃÂ better solutions for our clients.
Your prior experiences and the impact you personally had on the outcomes of those solutions, good and bad, will ultimately be the most important factor in determining if you are the right person for this role.
Along with a resumeÃÂ listing your relevant experience, please submit a cover letter explaining why youÃÂ are the perfect fit for what we seek.

name: Sr. Software Engineer Full Stack_30344
description:
Interviewing for a new company is a serious time commitment for all parties involved. Please take the time to read this and thoughtfully consider if we would be a good fit for one another. This is a full-time position. You must be located in the continental U.S. No contractors or agencies. Seriously.
Why We Started Very
Not to oversimplify things, but our mission is to become the best IoT, blockchain, and machine learning product development shop in the world. We do this by hiring the best and investing heavily in them, both personally and professionally.
We Fully Embrace Working Remotely
About 30% of our team works out of our HQ in Chattanooga, TN, and the other 70% work remotely from various locations across the United States. We consider ourselves best-practitioners of the remote-first movement and believe a great team shouldnÃ¢ÂÂt be restricted by geography.
What YouÃ¢ÂÂll Be Working On
Very is first and foremost a software consultancy, we tackle hard problems for clients who need a targeted, senior team to come in and provide specific solutions. We are focusing heavily on building out products that have applications in one of the three following areas: 1) data science & machine learning, 2) Internet of Things, and 3) blockchain. WeÃ¢ÂÂve found that in each of these areas, the use of the underlying technology will drive the development of the core services , but that 75% of the work often still lives in the realm of modern web development.
At Very, there is a never ending supply of variety to the types of projects we work on. In the last year weÃ¢ÂÂve built solutions that touch e-commerce, trust management (finance), beer distribution, point of sale systems, ICOÃ¢ÂÂs, identifying fake news, and much more.
YouÃ¢ÂÂll spend 80% of your week (Monday through Thursday) designing and building a product or platform for one of our clients. The other 20% of your week (Friday) will be spent contributing to our open source projects, internal products, learning, teaching, and participating in internal operations of all flavors.
Project teams are small and usually made up of one or two pairs of engineers, a UX engineer, a product manager, and the client who serves as the product owner. We spend most of our time building new products, with the goal of helping our clients take it to market. We are often further engaged by our clients to continue iterating on the product once it is live. The high cost of context switching is real, so we do our best to keep teams together throughout the duration of their projects (typically 3-6 months), but have found it valuable to rotate pairing partners when it makes reasonable sense.
We are always exploring new tools, languages, and technologies. We feel strongly that itÃ¢ÂÂs a good idea to use the best tool for the job and not see everything as a nail. We also try our best to standardize our technology and tooling across project teams so itÃ¢ÂÂs easier to rotate and practice collective code ownership. We are currently building products and platforms using the following tools / platforms:


React & React Native


Swift & Objective C


Elixir, Phoenix, and Nerves


Arduino (embedded C/C++)


Ethereum / Solidity


Ruby on Rails


Python


Pandas


Serverless


AWS (and a dash of Heroku where it makes sense)


Given that we work on quite a bit of greenfield projects, there is often room to experiment with new patterns and tools (within reason). We donÃ¢ÂÂt expect applicants to know our entire toolchain, but rather to be capable, flexible, and self-directed.
This Role: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer
As a full-stack engineer at Very, you will work on a wide variety of projects and stacks. This job is a great fit for pragmatic polyglot programmers with a functional bend. Over the last few years, weÃ¢ÂÂve shipped countless Ruby on Rails projects and are at the tail end of moving to Elixir for the bulk of our services. Additionally, we have a strong Python contingent who are utilizing the serverless framework for the development of highly targeted microservices / systems as well as for data science and machine learning projects.
We value well-tested, reusable code and expect our engineers to be as good of practitioners as they are leaders and teachers.
How We Operate
We are believers in transparency and openness. In terms of organizational structure and governance, we are a holacracy. ItÃ¢ÂÂs worked pretty well for the us the last few years. When it comes to development processes, we do our best to adhere as closely to Extreme Programming as possible. We believe in hiring capable, responsible professionals. We donÃ¢ÂÂt micromanage and trust everyone to work hard, experiment, learn from their mistakes, and contribute to each other and the company in a sustainable manner. We have no venture funding or external investors, which affords us the ability to be nimble and run our company in the best interest of our team as a whole.
How YouÃ¢ÂÂll Be Compensated
We believe in a transparent, fair compensation structure and have developed our own open salary formula. Depending on your skill and experience, you can expect to make somewhere between $80,000 and $135,000 upon joining the company. We have many health plans available through UHCÃ¢ÂÂprices and plans vary based on your regionÃ¢ÂÂas well as vision and dental. We currently contribute a large portion to each plan, again, amounts vary based on region. As an added benefit, Very provides 1X Earnings Basic Life & AD&D. We have a 401k program that weÃ¢ÂÂll provide a 2% match on after a few months working with us. Lastly, 35% of the companyÃ¢ÂÂs ownership is reserved for a team member options pool.

name: Sr. Software Engineer_30353
description:
Sr. Software Engineer // Phoenix & Nerves
Adult Beverage Company is a start up in the self-serve beer world. Our concept, called Hop, is currently open on the Las Vegas strip. We are in the process of further developing the product, making revolutionary changes to software and hardware with the intention of leading the way in this industry. We're looking for an experienced engineer that can be energetic about the concept, see its potential, and work to make our collective vision a reality. Setting and completing deadlines and communicating frequently with Upper Management will be required of this position. The ideal candidate will have experience in the development tools listed below, but will also be passionate about beer and excited about working for a new company with unlimited potential.
The current platform leverages the following modern frameworks and will be an exciting and stimulating codebase for the experienced full-stack developer:


Native iOS Client(s) - manages the tap-screens and the customer on-boarding process. This is the customerÃ¢ÂÂs primary interaction with the Hop platform. Codebases are written in both Swift and Objective C


Hardware - Raspberry Pi controlling a custom hardware configuration. The software controlling these devices has been written using Elixir, leveraging the Nerves framework


Web Application (API) - A central API to manage the orchestration of all the devices and various consumers, this is also written in Elixir, largely utilizing the phoenix framework


AWS Lambda - image processing and AWS Rekognition, primarily python


This Role: Sr. Software Engineer // Full Stack
This role will develop and manage the api and hardware services listed above. The ideal candidate will be a senior engineer who is also experienced in developing elixir. The platform is still under active development and once hired the candidate will be onboarded for a period of 6-8 weeks before assuming full ownership of the platform.
The ideal candidate will


Have 8+ year experience developing web applications


Have 2+ years elixir development


Have worked in real time systems


Be passionate about writing tests, automation and continuous deployment


Embrace Agile / XP


Understand the excitement of remotely controlling hardware from a web application


This is a full time contract position with on-call responsibilities.
Competitive Salary, D.O.E
Benefits are currently not offered by Adult Beverage Company
Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Remote
To apply, please send an email with the subject line Ã¢ÂÂHop - Full Stack EngineerÃ¢ÂÂ to jobs-hop@verypossible.com with the following information:


WhatÃ¢ÂÂs most important to you from a company culture and operating environment?


What are the biggest things that de-motivate you and make you unhappy when it comes to being an engineer working on teams within a company?




Your resume

name: Sr. UX Designer_30352
description:
Want to improve the lives of a couple million people?
WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre seeking a passionate contract UX designer to join our team that crafts tools used by millions of people around the world. YouÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll focus on the needs of a diverse set of people to help them prepare for the expected and handle the unexpected through the course of their day. You will be an important member of our design team, made up of individuals that actively support one another and love to solve problems.
Sound exciting? Great, read on!
What YouÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll Be Doing
Partnering with the Design Team Lead, product managers, developers and others throughout the company, youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll think through every aspect of core features, crafting new solutions that put the humans who use HotSchedules at the forefront. YouÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll implement a new design direction that focuses on the people that keep your favorite restaurants humming. The space we work in is deep, so you will have the opportunity to learn and design for a wide array of customer needs and challenges. The designs that you craft will be relied upon ÃÂÃÂ in a variety of contexts, from small phones to desktops across a wide variety of physical environments such as loud kitchens, behind the bar or in a back office. YouÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll make the complex, simple.
What WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre Looking For

A portfolio that showcases your UX chops (wireframes, user stories, flows) and product design skills. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre looking to see your product design work, not websites or marketing collateral. Please include a link with any needed passwords with your application.
5+ years of experience as a professional designer working on web or mobile products or services.
A true passion for user-centered design and an understanding of how to unite user goals with those of our business.
You understand the value of mentorship and enjoy helping other designers improve their work.
Mastery of Sketch or similar design tools (we use Sketch) and experience with InVision or similar prototyping tools.
A deep understanding of web and mobile design constraints.
Experience implementing and improving a design system.
You are interested in user research and want the opportunity to conduct, document and share the findings from in-context observations and user interviews.
The ability to jump from high-level concepts into detailed design conversations, and back again.
You are collaborative and communicative by nature. You know how to deliver and receive constructive criticism.
You have opinions, but you leave your ego at the door.
Bonus points for restaurant experience.ÃÂÃÂ  YouÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂve worked in restaurants or bars (double bonus points if youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂve designed apps that focus on people who work in the service industry, such as scheduling systems or Point of Sales (POS) solutions.


About this contract

5 months long
Must be onsite at our offices in NW Austin
FULL HEALTH, DENTAL and VISION insurance even for contractors!
Paid holidays

ÃÂ 
Work & Co (work.co) creates the digital products and experiences that millions of people love to use. In under 5 years, weÃ¢ÂÂve won attention from the most respected brands in the worldÃ¢ÂÂincluding Apple, YouTube, Facebook, Etsy, Target, Marriott, Aldo and Planned Parenthood.

Technical Directors at Work & Co lead small, highly collaborative teams to create world-class digital products and experiences that people use everyday. They work closely with designers, product managers, strategists, and QA engineers to concept, prototype, and execute on a range of products. Join us as we help our clients redefine entire industries.

name: Technical Lead_30407
description:
Recruiters and staffing companies NEED NOT contact us and DO NOT have permission to contact candidates on our behalf.ÃÂ 
Think Company is looking for an experienced Technical Lead to join our Development Team! Think Company is a team of business-minded designers, developers, and thinkers who help our clients envision, design, and create great experiences for their customers and employees. We assist our clients in creating, designing and developing their ideas, executing on those ideas, and making them a reality.
The Technical Lead is part of the core team of any project and the primary technical point of contact throughout its life cycle, including kickoff, research, design, development, and delivery. S/he works with our clients to understand their current technical state, recommends solutions that empower our clients to succeed in their goals, and leads a team of developers to successfully deliver thoseÃÂ technology solutions.
The ideal candidate for this role is a senior full-stackÃÂ developer or technology consultant who is comfortable both with writing code and withÃÂ socializing the problem orÃÂ solution. Candidates for this role must haveÃÂ development experience, including writing code and/or coaching others to write code that meets industry standards and best practices. Candidates should also be able to demonstrate prior experience with setting and ensuring compliance with coding standards, making browser and device support recommendations, solving application architecture challenges, advising on content management workflow and CMS configuration, analyzing and remediating page performance issues, and addressing accessibility issues.ÃÂ Candidates should have experience in accurately scoping projects, defining project requirements, translating business requirements into technical requirements, architecting the technical environment and hosting infrastructure, identifying milestones and managing a delivery team against those milestones.
Technical Lead Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain a deep understanding of clientÃ¢ÂÂs business and technology stack; establish and maintain a positive relationship with the client; represent Think Company with professionalism and integrity
Work collaboratively as part of a team that includes visual/UX designers, developers, project managers, and other roles (both clients and internal colleagues), flexing between a leadership or supporting role as required
Architect technical solutions that meet clients' business, IT, and user needs, and that balanceÃÂ time, budget, and quality considerations appropriately
Manage developers to deliver technical solutions on-time and on-budget, based on a technical delivery plan; work with project manager to communicate technical team status and manage client expectations
Research and document web development technologies, trends, and innovations, and make recommendations or deliver presentations to clients and internal colleagues

Skills and Requirements:

Extensive experience determining and analyzing technical project requirements, creating and managing a plan of work including identifying deliverablesÃÂ and estimating time
Significant experience in leading and coaching a development team to deliver technical deliverables on-time, on-budget, and on-spec
Deep understanding of the modern web platform and common architectural solutions
Significant experience with front-end developmentÃÂ practices includingÃÂ accessibility, progressiveÃÂ enhancement, cross-browser/platform compatibility, performance; and pre-processors/build tools
Significant experience with web application development on both the front-end (Angular, React, etc.) and back-end (PHP, .NET, Python, Ruby on Rails, etc.), and an understanding of the tools and platforms needed to host these solutions
SignificantÃÂ experience with content management systems (AEM, Sitecore, Drupal, WordPress, etc.) including data and information architecture, templating, workflow, etc.
Experience with git, svn, or similar version control systems and knowledge of Git Flow methodologies
Deep familiarity with user experience (UX) design processes (conceptual design, wireframes, usability testing)
Excellent presentation and communication skills
Exceptional customer service skills and obsessive attention to detail

Think Company's developers are passionate about crafting code that is as beautiful and as elegant as our designs. We believe in web standards, progressive enhancement, and accessibility. We aim to build an open and faster web while delivering real value for our clients. We are a team of individuals with diverse skills who love learning and sharing knowledge. We hope you will join us!
To apply, please submit a cover letter or statement of interest, a resume, and three URLs featuring your code (or a link to your Github account with at least three projects). We look forward to hearing from you!
About Think Company
Think Company is an experience design consultancy that provides research, user experience design, and software development services to Fortune 500 clients in a wide range of industries. Think Company has been named one of the Best Places to Work by the Philadelphia Business Journal forÃÂ threeÃÂ years in a row.
Think Company provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.
Perks

Competitive salary and excellent benefits, including health, dental, life, and disability insurance;ÃÂ 401 (k);ÃÂ paid time off;ÃÂ and individual training budgets
Regular company outings andÃÂ hosts to local meetups like CTO School andÃÂ UX Book Club, plus two PTO days to volunteer for the cause of your choice
Awesome teammates who are committed to growing skills and sharing knowledge
Inspiring, creative workspaces in Conshohocken, PA and Center City Philadelphia: both with easy access to public transportation and within walking distance of great restaurants

name: UX Design Team Manager_30305
description:
Do what you love. Love why you do it. HereÃ¢ÂÂs a rare opportunity to serve a digital leadership role at ALSAC, the organization responsible for raising funds and awareness for St. Jude ChildrenÃ¢ÂÂs Research Hospital Ã¢ÂÂ the #1 hospital charity in the nation, the #1 health nonprofit brand of the year, a Top 10 nonprofit by revenue, where 95% of employees agree weÃ¢ÂÂre a great place to work. 
As the UX Design Manager, your team of UI developers, UX architects and digital designers will lead and evolve the user experience design function at ALSAC, playing a strategic role in aligning team structure and processes with the market needs and enterprise strategy to help fulfill our mission of connecting supporters, donors and fundraisers to St. Jude through engaging and inspiring digital experiences.ÃÂ 
As a member of the ALSAC Digital team, you will work in an Agile development environment, providing user-centered design practices that connect our product development and digital marketing work with the users we serve, via user research, usability testing, user-centered design, and design thinking practices. 
Your role as UX Design Manager involves directing the creation and iteration of user interface standards and design patterns across multiple technology platforms. You will also serve as an advocate for brand standards and help to ensure that design implementations foster a consistent brand identity, as well as user experience across all digital touch points. 
Responsibilities
ÃÂ We are looking for people who are skilled in the full spectrum of user experience who will:ÃÂ

description:

name: UX Engineer - CONTRACT OR FT_30339
description:
At Maark we believe that every interaction a user has with a product should be designed with them in mind. That doesn't just take the combined efforts of user experience and visual designers but also the designers who build the interactions. UX Engineers bring designs to life and sweat every detail. They focus on adding animations and details to interfaces not to just delight users but to improve their understanding of what the UI is doing. At Maark we believe this role is extremely important to creating the best possible experience for our clients and their customers.
As a UX Engineer at Maark you will work as part of the design team and develop front-end interfaces for the web. This is primarily a development role and will work closely with the engineering team as well. As part of the design process you will translate concepts into prototypes to test potential animations, interactions, design details, and feedback mechanisms. As a team we all try to keep up on the design industry and we'd look to you to contribute input on trends and new ways for users to interact with devices and interfaces.
As a team, we work together in person at least once a week but for the rest of the week we work remotely. Over the years we have found that people who are well organized and are comfortable managing their own personal time fit best. On top of that, the clients we work with range from large financial institutions to telecoms to hospitality to bio-engineering Ã¢ÂÂ we love learning new subjects and researching our clients' businesses and look to work with people who are just as naturally curious.
What you would work on...

Building front-end interfaces for the web
Translating concepts into working prototypes
Iterating on interactions, animations, feedback, and design details reaching for the best experience possible
Providing input on trends and new ways for users to interact with devices and data

You may be a fit for this role if you...

Have a BA/BS degree in Computer Science, HCI, Design, or equivalent
Have experience developing for web applications
Have experience creating interactive prototypes
Have an expert understanding of HTML, CSS (SASS/Less), and JavaScriptÃ¢ÂÂspecifically ES6, React, and Webpack
Care for code quality, user experience, and design details
Have a strong appreciation for design, typography, and visual systems
Are very well organized and strong personal time management
Have a natural interest in researching and learning new subjects and our clients' businesses

Nice to have experience

A design portfolio showcasing a strong foundation in typography, visual systems, interaction design, visual design, and a design process
Experience developing interfaces for iOS and/or Android
Experience in design planning and information architecture development

Full-Time Benefits

Competitive salary
100% health and dental
New 5k iMac or laptop
401(k) with company match
Generous paid time off plan

About Maark
Maark is a strategic marketing and innovation agency for global companies - headquartered in Cambridge, MA. We help our clients define and articulate their vision, design new connected customer experiences, and develop applications at the intersection of where whatÃ¢ÂÂs possible meets whatÃ¢ÂÂs relevant. The Maark creative team is made up of artists, illustrators, designers, and developers, all focused on creating the best experiences for B2B markets.
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better experience for our clients.
Maark is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of Maark to prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and to afford equal employment opportunities to all persons without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran-status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

name: Software Engineer - Fullstack
description:
Company Description

Vlocity is a fast-growing enterprise applications company focused on bringing industry-specific business processes to the cloud. With 300 employees around the world and customers on six continents, Vlocity has been the fastest-growing independent software vendor on the Salesforce platform for two years running. Vlocity is currently shipping version 15 of its application suite, and has raised over $100MM in capital from investors including Salesforce.com, Accenture and Sutter Hill Ventures.

Vlocity develops software to help communications, media & energy providers, insurance carriers and government agencies digitally engage customers through their channels and devices of choice. We serve dozens of the worldÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs Fortune 5000 companies including Sky Italia, Telecom Italia, TELUS, 3, Telecom Argentina, Cellcom, New York Life, Farmers Insurance, Harvard Pilgrim, and Anthem. Our solutions run on our customersÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ web sites, in their contact centers and on the mobile devices of their service and sales professionals ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ providing a compelling, modern, omnichannel experience. Despite the complexity and sophistication of the enterprise business processes we enable, we believe the user experience should be as simple and compelling as a consumer application.

Job Description

Vlocity, Inc. is recruiting full stack application developers to join our fast growing startup. These
developers will have the unique opportunity to shape and create Vlocity's vertical apps from the ground
up built on the Salesforce Platform.

As an early developer, you will be responsible for designing and implementing product requirements that are highly usable, scalable, extensible, and maintainable, in large part on the Force.com platform. You will work in a highly agile environment, with product managers, engineers and customers, as well as with our leadership team, using iterative and test-driven design methods. You will be developing modern, web-based applications for the Salesforce1 Platform using Visualforce, Apex, Javascript, HTML/CSS, and other technologies. An understanding of relational & NoSql databases is a plus.

We are going to build our industry apps on modern technology stacks. Force.com and Salesforce1 will be our cloud-based CRM platform. We will add additional technology stacks as needed and you'll be part of that analysis and development process.

Responsibilities

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Design and develop products in Visualforce, Apex, SalesForce1, Javascript, HTML/CSS, and
related technologies.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Object and entity modelling on Force.com platform.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Write create clean, effective code for simple or complex user tasks.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Work in an agile, rapid development and prototyping environment where effective communication
is paramount.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Contribute to building a positive, can-do, high-performance culture.

Experience

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ 3+ years of product development experience.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Experience with the Spring framework, JDBC, Maven and other Java related technologies.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Excellent understanding of object-oriented design patterns & experience with OO languages
(Java, Ruby, Python, Scala etc).

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Excellent Data Structure and Algorithms experience.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Experience building web-based user interfaces, with a deep understanding of HTML, Javascript,
and CSS.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Experience with and knowledge of relational databases.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Familiarity with JavaScript libraries such as jQuery, AngularJS, Backbone.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Experience and desire to work within a fast-paced, iterative development environment;

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Experience with Agile development is a strong plus.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Experience with Force.com and the SalesForce1 platform is a plus.

ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Stellar academic background, Bachelor degree or equivalent experience required, specializing in
computer science or similar engineering discipline.

name: Software Engineer
description:
SUMMARY - Software Engineer
The Software Engineer's primary responsibility is to develop new and upgrade existing internal programs and software that help facilitate the device testing and inventory processes. This role will also include some web development tasks including working with APIs from various companies (including but not limited to eBay, Amazon, USPS, FedEx, etc.) to integrate our internal systems with theirs. Currently, the devices we handle are consumer electronics (including but not limited to phones, iPads, and other such gadgets) so basic knowledge of these items is required, though this list may expand in the future. This position works under general supervision and interacts with upper management daily.

Please note, we are looking for in-house development, not remote. Candidates will need to be local to us in Eden Prairie, MN

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES


Develop new and upgrade existing software to facilitate testing and inventory control processes, seeking to automate as many tasks as possible for the team.
Analyze existing code base to ensure optimal language(s) are used, potentially converting existing code to a different language.
Work with upper management to address bugs, issues, or other such problems as they arise.
Pivot between multiple different projects as needed, taking lead on each one.
Assist with development of website and backend integrations.
Develop tools for Android and iOS platforms that achieve the above.
Communicate all issues to upper management that could result in process delays, safety issues, or otherwise cause a loss to the company or its associates.
Work closely with other team members of all departments to ensure that all software needs are met.
BASIC & PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS


Must be at least 18 years of age.
Previous software development experience required.
Working knowledge of programming languages, primarily: Ruby, JavaScript, Node.JS, Swift, MySQL/NoSQL Databases ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ languages may also include Java and Rails. Note that you will not necessarily need to learn all of these together, but the ability to create and edit code is the requirement and known languages can be addressed in the interview process.
Knowledge of Excel a plus, but not required.
Previous experience with mobile device testing or refurbishment preferred.
Working knowledge of mobile operating systems (Android, iOS, Windows, etc.) and their development languages highly preferred.
High school diploma or GED required, college preferred.
Must be available to work for extended periods during high volume periods (up to 8 hours per day, with possibility of weekend shifts) or to address "business critical" issues.
Experience with aforementioned APIs (eBay, Amazon, USPS, FedEx) is ideal.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS, JOB SKILLS, & ABILITIES


Ability to communicate effectively with others using spoken and written English.
Ability to work under demanding time constraints and production goals.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and shift task priorities if necessary.
Salary will be based on experience, competence, and proven efficiency.

Who are we looking for

name: Senior Full - Stack Engineer
description:
A bit about us:

Devoted Health is a new health care company looking to improve the lives of seniors in America. We are guided by a deep belief that every senior should be treated like we would treat our own family members: with loving care and a profound commitment to their health and well-being.  With aging demographics and rising health costs, this is an industry and problem space that needs todayÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs best talent working on solutions with high integrity and a long term view. We will improve the lives of seniors by helping them navigate the health care system, by utilizing world-class technology and data to enable a simplified experience, by partnering with top providers for better health outcomes. We are building a stellar team to drive towards our starting point goal to launch a Medicare Advantage plan and clinical services in 2019.

Why Devoted:

Make a difference... a big difference. You will have the opportunity, in a unique and dynamic culture, to be a part of something incredibly meaningful. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre a disruptive startup with an inspiring mission. Learn and grow alongside our world-class team of health care, technology, and data leaders, dedicated to building a health plan and clinical services that care for everyone like they were our own mothers or fathers. Our team and board members have decades of experience in health care entrepreneurship, data, technology, services, and policy. With their support, we look forward to building a health plan and clinical services that will give seniors easy access to the high-quality care they deserve.

A bit more about this role:

Technology does amazing things in our daily lives, yet often is a source of pain and confusion within health care.  We want to empower Devoted to deliver a world-class member experience with simple, flexible technical systems.  If we need to delve into the murky underbelly of health care IT to do that, weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre up for the challenge.  

Our north star is not a specific technology, but rather the goal of continually increasing the leverage of every member of the team. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre currently building with Go, PostgreSQL, gRPC, GraphQL, React, TypeScript, Terraform, and AWS, and we think itÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs a pretty awesome stack.

We want engineer-owners with the judgment to simultaneously solve for short and long-term business value.  WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre looking for folks who have worked in complex domains and systems, and come through it with some wisdom but most importantly humility.  We want people who are passionate about building great technology to solve problems for usersÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂour members, our colleagues, and ourselves.

Whether you have a health care background or not, we are excited to learn from and share knowledge with you.  Our engineering leadership team includes seasoned alumni of health care and technology organizations spanning the public and private sector.  Our co-founders deeply understand and care about good technology:  Todd Park co-founded Athenahealth, a multi-billion-dollar health care technology company, and served as CTO of the U.S.; Ed Park was Athenahealth's founding engineer and served as its CTO, COO, and President of Services.

Responsibilities will include:


Building product features across a range of technologies
Working with subject matter experts to understand and design solutions to improve our members lives
Working with other members of the technology team to improve our technology platform
Attributes to success:


Experience coupled with a willingness to learn new things
Comfort with uncertainty and a desire to be close to business problems
Desire to contribute individually, with the ability both to self-direct work and to collaborate with others on the technology team
Understanding of many technologies down to first principles, and a desire to add more to the list
Desired skills and experience:


5+ years working as an individual technical contributor
Experience with our specific stack components a bonus but not required
Bonus: Prior backgrounds in product management, UX or data science; we often ask folks to wear more than one hat
If you love running towards complex challenges and transforming them into solutions, if you want to make a potentially huge impact on many lives, and if you are looking for a disruptive startup with an inspiring and talented team, Devoted Health may be the place for you.

description:
Loco2's mission is to make booking trains anywhere in Europe as easy and affordable as possible, from epic international adventures to everyday local commutes. Our booking coverage is unrivalled and growing.

WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre hiring two experienced web developers to join our existing team of six, where youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll help rebuild the front-end of our website into a modern single-page application using React. We know React is a new technology, and weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre willing to consider anyone with demonstrable JavaScript experience and a desire to learn and grow.

At Loco2 we care deeply about building an inclusive, open and supportive work environment. We behave with respect for people and the planet and are seeking a diverse range of candidates that share these values.

About us

We're a small, passionate and cosmopolitan team, with a healthy remote-first culture and an office based in London. Our success is built on trust, empathy and shared knowledge, with our users at the centre of what we do. We're proud to have an average rating of 9.3 out of 10 on Trustpilot after 22,000 reviews.

WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂve been selling tickets since 2012 (read our full story here), and weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre growing rapidly as the business matures. Our goal is to scale effectively whilst continuing to delight our users.

Why join us?


We have high codings standards, and follow best practices such as continuous testing and delivery
We strive to learn and improve together in a supportive environment as the wider tech ecosystem evolves
Our team enjoys a healthy work-life balance and donÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂt think caffeine-fuelled all-nighters are a good way to grow a company thatÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs built to last
We offer flexible hours and a well-designed remote working culture built on trust. Work around your schedule and when youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre most productive
Our days are not full of meetings and needless distractions, allowing others to achieve flow is a big part of supporting each other
Everyone is encouraged to ask questions, think creatively and suggest new working practices, we have a small team so your voice will be heard
You will be provided with a laptop and are empowered to make changes that improve your working environment
Tech stack and role description

WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre transitioning our traditional multi-page application to a React-powered single-page application so our customers can enjoy a fast, reliable and consistent experience across all of their devices.

This role is focused on that challenge, working with experienced members of our existing team to help us separate concerns and scale effectively without succumbing to the potential pitfalls of a microservices approach.

The new front-end will use modern technologies, including React, TypeScript, Redux and modular CSS. We know React is a new technology, and weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre willing to consider anyone with demonstrable JavaScript experience and a desire to learn and grow, with Ruby experience as a nice-to-have.

Whilst we donÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂt expect you to be a master of the following technologies, our current software stack consists of:


A Ruby library for communicating with train booking APIs
A traditional multi-page web application written in Ruby on Rails, using CoffeeScript and SCSS
AWS hosted Docker infrastructure, with continuous delivery
A hybrid iOS app written in Swift
A hybrid Android app written in Kotlin
About you

An ideal candidate:


Has 3+ years of professional web development experience
Deep knowledge and experience of JavaScript, HTML and CSS, and ideally Ruby (or a similar server-side language)
Is excited about the future of the web platform, the ever evolving JavaScript ecosystem and is motivated to help Loco2 adopt modern front-end technologies and processes
Takes pride in their craft and adheres to industry best practices such as testing, code linting, peer review and clean modular maintainable code
Has a keen appetite appetite for self-improvement and growth, but doesn't hesitate to ask for help when needed
Strives to discover and understand the root cause of problems, suggesting new and improved solutions, rather than treating the symptoms
Is fluent in English and confident communicating and sharing complex information and learnings with both technical and non-technical team members
Can work hours that have some overlap with London daytime
Is motivated by Loco2's mission

name: Software Developer (Functional Programming)
description:
Software Developer 

Jane Street is a proprietary quantitative trading firm, focusing primarily on trading equities and equity derivatives. We use innovative technology, a scientific approach, and a deep understanding of markets to stay successful in our highly competitive field. We operate around the clock and around the globe, employing over 500 people in offices in New York, London and Hong Kong.

The markets in which we trade change rapidly, but our intellectual approach changes faster still. Every day, we have new problems to solve and new theories to test. Our entrepreneurial culture is driven by our talented team of traders and programmers. At Jane Street, we don't come to work wanting to leave. We come to work excited to test new theories, have thought-provoking discussions, and maybe sneak in a game of ping-pong or two. Keeping our culture casual and our employees happy is of paramount importance to us.

We are looking to hire great software developers with an interest in functional programming. OCaml, a statically typed functional programming language with similarities to Haskell, Scheme, Erlang, F# and SML, is our language of choice. We've got the largest team of OCaml developers in any industrial setting, and probably the world's largest OCaml codebase. We use OCaml for running our entire business, supporting everything from research to systems administration to trading systems. If you're interested in seeing how functional programming plays out in the real world, there's no better place.

The atmosphere is informal and intellectual. There is a focus on education, and people learn about software and trading, both through formal classes and on the job. The work is challenging, and you get to see the practical impact of your efforts in quick and dramatic terms. Jane Street is also small enough that people have the freedom to get involved in many different areas of the business. Compensation is highly competitive, and there's a lot of room for growth.

You can learn more about Jane Street and our technology from our main site, janestreet.com. You can also look at a a talk given at CMU about why Jane Street uses functional programming (http://ocaml.janestreet.com/?q=node/61), and our programming blog (http://ocaml.janestreet.com).

We also have extensive benefits, including:


90% book reimbursement for work-related books
90% tuition reimbursement for continuing education
Excellent, zero-premium medical and dental insurance
Free lunch delivered daily from a selection of restaurants
Catered breakfasts and fresh brewed Peet's coffee
An on-site, private gym in New York with towel service
Kitchens fully stocked with a variety of snack choices
Full company 401(k) match up to 6% of salary, vests immediately
More information at http://janestreet.com/culture/benefits/
subjects: Probability, Programming Languages, Operating Systems, Software Testing, Game Development, Operations, Other Programming, Happiness, Gaming, Industry

Own Your Time
We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Learn at your Edges

CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentorship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag

description:

Yoyo Chinese helps thousands of language learners around the world learn Mandarin using hundreds of video lessons and other interactive learning tools like flashcards, quizzes, and progress tracking.

Our site is built in Node.js and we're looking for a full-time (or close to full-time) developer who can join our team and is capable of taking over our existing code and maintaining what we've already built (general site maintenance and squashing bugs) as well as helping us continue to develop and improve the app into the future with updates and new features as the company grows.

You'll work directly with our product and project managers as a Yoyo team member. We're also beginning development on a mobile app and you'll work directly with our mobile developers to help ensure the Yoyo Chinese experience is seamless across all platforms.

We'd like to find a developer who believes in our mission of teaching the world Chinese and is looking for a long-term relationship with our company. You must have proven experience as a qualified Node.js developer and excellent English communication and project management skills.

WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre located in LA county, but your time zone and working location are flexible and can be discussed.

Development work includes both front-end and back-end, as well as database development.

Working with mobile development team to help turn our web-app into a 5-star mobile app on both iOS and Android platforms, launching both apps simultaneously
Qualifications


At least 2 years of Node.js full-stack development, having participated in the development of - 2 products with ample experience with iterative development. 
Proficient in Node.js server-side frameworks
Proficient in basic HTML5/Javascript/CSS3/Ajax
Proficient in Express + Jade framework, with relevant development experience using similar technology.

description:
Magazino stands for robotics in a real world application with the best ROS team in Europe with which we are on the edge of new technologies. We offer interesting and challenging tasks, responsibility from the beginnig, freedom of choice, a relaxed atmosphere, a bundle of benefits and a fantasic team. Are you interested how this looks like? Come and see! 

Your tasks


Design and implement scalable software solutions in all areas of the robot, including task-level coordination, information management, automated reasoning
Test and evaluation of the developed approaches in real warehouses at our customersÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ sites
Support and advice the team in complex software and implementation issues
Requirements


Phd or M.Sc. in Computer Science or a related field
3+ years of software engineering and database experience
Experience with design and implementation of complex behaviours
Proficiency in Python as well as ROS on Linux platforms
Nice to have: Knowledge in Prolog/ logic programming
Fluent English required, basic knowledge of German helpful
What we have to offer


A future-oriented job in a quickly growing startup
High personal responsibility & room to maneuver
An innovative team with flat hierarchies
100% startup atmosphere and regular team events
Free lunch and Drinks

name: Infrastructure Engineer Lead
description:
Orion Labs is dedicated to revolutionizing the way that people communicate. Our heads-up, wearable-enabled voice communication service helps people to stay connected across any distance and to collaborate more effectively.

Orion Labs was founded by people who helped to shape the DevOps movement, and we are proud to continue in that tradition. Our products run on a high-availability, microservices-oriented platform, which supports a variety of voice-streaming clients and integrations.

We're looking for an experienced engineer to join our team as Infrastructure Lead!

About you:
You have years of hard-won experience building and operating robust cloud-based web services infrastructure.
You instrument and monitor everything you possibly can.
You automate everything to keep from being woken up in the middle of the night.
You love collaborating to design and implement elegant systems, but you're also ready to roll up your sleeves and get the job done.
You know how to mentor and empower other engineers to succeed at their work.
You've led an engineering team before, or you're a strong senior engineer ready to make the leap.
You are eager to learn!

About us:
Our stack is implemented on AWS in a mix of Python and Go.
We treat infrastructure as code, provisioning everything with Terraform and Chef, and we're starting to use Docker.
We believe that Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment mitigates risk, and you should too.
We think of "DevOps" both as a kind of culture, and as a pattern for rapid change.
We value confidence, humility, engagement, inclusiveness, consensus, and mutual trust.

We don't need you to be an expert in any particular technology -- we expect you to have a variety of tools in your kit, and the thoughtfulness to weigh trade-offs and apply each one wisely.

We have a lot of interesting problems to solve as we continue to grow and scale out! As Infrastructure Lead, you'll help us design the future of the Orion Platform, and then enable your team to collaborate with others to build it.

Come join us on this adventure! (And send us a link to your public Github profile, if you have one!)

Orion is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive team with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences. This means striving to hire a diverse set of humans and providing them with support, mentorship, and opportunities to grow. We firmly believe that hiring and supporting a diverse team is valuable endeavor in itself, and also allows us to do our best work and make better products. We donÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂt discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, ability status, or any other differences. 
All are welcome here. 

Trans Can Work certified employer, 2017
subjects: Operating Systems, Communications, Web Design, Productivity, Religion & Spirituality, Design Tools, Instruments, Production, Operations, Humanities, Design Thinking

name: Full Stack Developer
description:
Booking.com is looking for Full Stack Developers all around the globe!  Join us in our beautiful Amsterdam headquarters and work on planet EarthÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs #1 accommodation website with the industryÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs smartest people! Our guiding principle is that by helping users we help our business 

B.Responsible 

As a Full Stack Developer, you are responsible for developing world-class, complete web applications, both on the backend and frontend, for monitoring and addressing performance and security, and for developing customer-focused and scalable user experiences. You will work side-by-side with designers, product owners, copywriters and other developers to create new features, test your own ideas, and push changes live for billions of users. You will:

Deliver web applications from an idea inception and validation to a scalable solution.
Collaborate with colleagues to ideate solutions for users, prioritizing based on business impact, and A/B test them.
Develop new user-facing products and optimize existing ones using both client-side as well as server-side languages and technologies

B.Skilled  

Understanding the full stack of web development, from transmission of data segments between networks to presenting a well-strategized experience to users is vitally important in this role. We need self-starters who are great at solving problems, who initiate discussions, are solutions-oriented, customer focused and believe that any challenge can be scaled with the right mindset and tools. We are looking for:


Experience working on products that impact a large user base or in an entrepreneurial startup environment.
Experience with data-driven product development: analytics, A/B testing, etc.
Self-starters with a collaborative, ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂcan-doÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ attitude.
Quick delivery of end-to-end solutions to validate ideas and produce quality products
A minimum of 3 years of experience with one or more general purpose programming languages, including but not limited to: Perl, Java, Python, Scala, C++ and Web development with JavaScript, HTML, CSS and HTTP.
Experience debugging cross-browser compatibility issues.
Experience  working on a command line in a Linux environment.
Passionate learners who arenÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂt afraid of new tools and technologies to build a great end-to-end customer experience.
B.Offered  

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We offer what we call the ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂBooking DealÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ with other competitive perks and benefits. We have tech talks, trainings, and support you attending and speaking at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and, in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.  We successfully relocate hundreds of IT professionals and their families to Amsterdam every year. Join us! 

The hiring company Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.comÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. Booking.com BV is looking for a Full Stack Developer in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. All references to ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂBooking.com" refer to Booking.com BV.

This role works with the IT Director and other IT staff to engineer, implement, maintain and support the information technology server and network infrastructure. name: PHP Back-End Developer
description:
VKS is seeking a talented, passionate, roll-up-your-sleeves, hands-on, highly independent PHP Developer.

As a Back-End Developer, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining robust back-end services. Our team works at a fast pace on an awesome product that is constantly evolving and improving so we're looking for someone who can pick things up quickly. Your job will be dynamic, interesting and challenging. We have a passionate and dedicated team, and offer a respectful and healthy work environment.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain clean, efficient, secure, and well-engineered back-end code that conforms with accepted standards.

Produce detailed specifications for each new feature or enhancement.

Communicate and collaborate effectively with team members.

Proactively identify opportunities for process and software improvements and make constructive suggestions for change.

Identify new technologies that can improve product development and the user experience.
Work closely with databases.

Build and maintain unit tests.

Design and create web services for front-end use and integration with other systems.

Ensure that customer issues and technology failures are detected, isolated, and resolved rapidly, and prevented from happening again.

Create and adhere to timelines for multiple projects and stakeholders

Skills & Requirements:

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience.

3+ years experience developing rich, large-scale web applications

Expert level coding skills in PHP.

Experience with many modern back-end technologies, such as Symfony (versions 1.x to 4.x), Lavarel, Zend, CakePHP, etc..

Strong database skills and experience with MySQL.

Experience with XML, Web Services and REST.

Strong Linux experience (the software currently runs on CentOS and Red Hat).

Experience in writing functional specifications.

Experience with GitHub or an equivalent source management system.

Significant web design experience taking projects from concept to code to market.

Experience with collaboration tools like Google Docs and Jira.

Experience building multilingual applications.

Have detail-oriented and strong problem-solving skills.

Ability to work independently while participating actively in an Agile/SCRUM environment.

Strong organization skills, self-motivated, team player, multi-tasking capability.

You are satisfied only when things are perfect.

Preference given to bilingual (English and French, spoken and written) candidates.

It's a plus if you also have experience withÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¦
Docker
Jenkins
ElasticSearch
The concept of micro services
PositionÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ: Permanent

Start date: As soon as possible

Indemnities: To be discussed

Work schedule: 40 hours/week, flexible

name: Head of Engineering
description:
We're looking for a Head of Engineering to lead our growing engineer team who is excited about leading engineering efforts for a system that will transform how user data will be managed for every consumer app across the web.

Someone who is a seasoned professional who has ideally worked in both small scrappy teams, as well as larger structured team. Someone who is capable of solving complex computer science problems and not afraid to roll up their sleeves.

About You:

Effective team builder: not your first rodeo. You know how to effectively build a world-class engineering team, and do not need a Facebook budget to do it.

Well versed with API's: you're an expert at understanding and writing API's, and enjoy creating maintainable and scalable systems.

Excellent communication skills: ability to effectively manage communication between engineers, stakeholders, and product teams in a remote capacity.

Multi-task: you're able to effectively manage and lead multiple projects.

Adaptable: ability to adjust and stay agile while scaling an organization. 

Blockchain: Blockchain, Solidity Smart Contracts, IPFS: the more experience the better.

Benefits:

Token package: you will receive tokens as a part of your comp package. If you're familiar with blockchain you know this is 10x better than stock options.

Remote: we are headquartered in San Francisco, but the majority of our team is remote. Whether in SF or not, you will have the opportunity to work the majority of your week in a remote capacity.

Following: dock.io has one of the largest and fastest growing communities in crypto, as well as an "alpha" app, which is growing by more than 3,000 new registered users per day.

name: EOI - Functional Programming Software Engineers
description:
Are you passionate about functional programming?
We seek 5 new engineers of various experience levels
Join Data61's Queensland Functional Programming Lab
The Position

Data61 is the largest technology innovation group in Australia. Bringing together CSIROÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs Productivity team and National ICT Australia (NICTA), we are unrivalled in our intellectual capital and our network with the global technology marketplace.

We are currently seeking Functional Programming Software Engineers to fill five vacancies. These roles span early-career through to senior software engineer roles. In these roles, you will develop open-source software using functional programming with an emphasis on application to industry problems. The positions will be based in Data61ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs Engineering & Design Group with allocation to our Queensland Functional Programming Lab.

We require developers with a diversity of skills in programming, particularly in industry application, and with a strong desire to improve quality of software through functional programming. Early-career Functional Programmers, with aspirations to take advantage of the technical benefits of functional programming, are encouraged to apply. A commitment to self-directed learning is essential for this role.

In this role you will:


Develop software systems using functional programming techniques.
Work collaboratively with project team members including project leaders, engineers and researchers.
Make use of functional programming tools and processes for efficiency of software development and ensuring software quality.
Contribute to open source projects.
Contribute to Data61ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs engineering discipline by participating in discussions of software development tools, processes and culture.
Maintain high ethical and performance standards.
Location:    Brisbane, QLD
Salary:        Various, to reflect early-career through to senior level 
Tenure:       5 positions, specified term of up to 3 years. 
Ref No.:      56235

To be successful you will need:


An ability to demonstrate functional programming principles using programming languages such as Haskell, Purescript or Idris.
Self-directed and motivated learner, who seeks out knowledge by own volition.
Experience with revision control systems such as git, darcs or mercurial.
An understanding and commitment to principles of open-source software.
Willingness to comply with company Equal Opportunity and Occupational Health and Safety policies.
Desirable Technical Expertise:


Skills in front-end development, preferably using languages such as Haskell or Purescript.
Skills and experience in compiler theory and programming language design.
Skills in creating or improving language tooling and library documentation.
Experience with existing machine learning programming tools and a desire to improve on those.
Experience with programming in an industry setting and familiarity with its typical challenges.
We imagine. We collaborate. We innovate. At CSIRO, we do the extraordinary every day. We innovate for tomorrow and help improve today ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ for our customers, all Australians and the world. We do this by using science and technology to solve real issues. Diversity is the compass that navigates our innovation. We provide an inclusive workplace that respects, values and actively pursues the benefits of a diverse workforce.

We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Find out more! CSIRO Balance

How to apply:

To register your interest you will be required to submit your resume and cover letter, as one document, highlighting your experience as relevant to the role requirements. Please apply via https://jobs.csiro.au/job/Brisbane%2C-QLD-EOI-Functional-Programming-Software-Engineers/463348700/

name: Customer Service
description:

name: Director, Software R&D
description:
Director, Software R&D(Job Number: 3808180220)

Description:
Johnson & Johnson Vision Surgical, part of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is currently recruiting for a Director, Software - R&D to be located in Milpitas, Ca or Santa Ana, Ca
.
Johnson & Johnson Vision Surgical ("JJVS") is focused on the discovery, development and commercialization of medical devices for cataract and refractive surgery. As a global cataract leader, JJVS provides intraocular lenses (both monofocal reimbursed and premium IOLs) that are specially designed to provide optimized visual outcomes, phacoemulsification and femtosecond laser equipment to safely and efficiently remove cataracts and a full offering of surgical adjuncts, including sterile viscosurgical devices/solutions.

JJVS is the global market leader in the presbyopia correcting IOL marketplace and holds strong #2 positions in all other cataract surgery markets in which it competes. JJVS is also the global market leader in laser refractive surgery and provides excimer and femtosecond lasers and advanced diagnostic devices for corneal refractive surgery. JJVS provides its products in more than 150 countries (more than 60 with a direct sales presence) worldwide.

The Director, Software - R&D, will be responsible for leadership and management of software R&D personnel.

The Director, Software - R&D will:


Direct the planning and execution of software development and technical support for J&J Vision's equipment product lines, which currently includes femtosecond lasers, excimer lasers, integrated aberrometer/topographer diagnostic systems, phacoemulsification devices, dry eye diagnostic and treatment systems, apps and websites.
Assure compliance of all software and software- related activities with J&J, government, quality and regulatory standards, policies and procedures.
Address compliance with applicable Enterprise and Business Unit policies and procedures.
Lead and manage the development and technology transfer of software solutions for J&J Vision's current Product Portfolio includes excimer lasers, femtosecond lasers, aberrometer/topographer diagnostic systems, phacoemulsification systems, dry eye diagnostic and treatment systems and associated products.
Lead the development and integration of software products that meet the needs of the company's customers.
Provide the company with significant competitive differentiation against competitive companies and support the revenue growth requirements of the business.
Provide leadership and vision for a multi-site R&D software teams via the development and implementation of comprehensive software design for the lifecycle of the various product lines.
Lead resource allocation, budgeting, outsourcing allocation, and personnel development as it relates to software development.
Both directly and through subordinates, account for product development, product quality, documentation, support and packaging of software components.
Work closely with the various cross-functional leaders to coordinate development of software and hardware to ensure timely registration and commercialization of J&J Vision's equipment products.
Supervise and lead Manager and Senior Manager level software professionals.
Direct responsibility for software engineers, consultants and technicians.
Direct the development and execution of software strategies and tactical plans to ensure the development, registration and commercialization of J&J Vision's equipment products, while following internal policies and procedures and applicable US and Foreign regulatory standards and requirements.
Prepare, manage and direct the execution of the Software R&D operating budget.
Hire, train and ensure retention of high-caliber individuals within the Software R&D organization.
Identify, retain and direct external software consultants and consultancy firms.
Qualifications:


BS in Software Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent is required, advanced degree (MS or PhD) preferred.
10 years of experience in the conduct and management of software and product development with at least 5 years of experience in developing software for medical devices is required.
Excellent technical judgement and strong leadership skills as evidenced by a succession of technical software management positions with increasing responsibility is required.
Experience in software development and new product commercialization in the medical device industry as demonstrated by a track record of successful development and commercialization of new products is required.
Experience with cybersecurity and IoT (Internet of Things) is required.
Familiarity with ophthalmic surgery is preferred.
Complete understanding of software design, development, requirements management, and verification and validation processes, including the use of state of the art tools for management thereof is required.
Excellent communication skills including both written and verbal in required
Up to 10-15% domestic travel is required.
Primary Location:
North America-United States-California-Santa Ana

Other Location: North America-United States-California-Milpitas

Organization:
AMO US Holdings, Inc.. (6234)

Job Function:
R&D

Travel
0-10%

Apply Here: http://www.Click2Apply.net/4gm2kz3p8skqx985
