name: Global Head of Data
description:
The role
Summary:
Take ownership, train and grow the data engineering and statistical learning ("data science") team of the largest Logistics company in South East Asia, covering a population three times the size of USÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ. We are headquartered above Tanjong Pagar in Singapore, with a great view and year round warm weather.

Situation:
Alibaba Group has injected two billion dollars into Lazada Group, a South East Asian conglomerate whose logistics arm, Lazada eLogistics (LeL), provides end to end logistics services and acts as a logistics marketplace.

LeL is a data driven business, but the data function is still embryonic. Our CEO and CTO themselves are pushing for the creation of a dedicated data engineering and data science team to take its place at the centre of the company. 

A data warehouse project has begun, with 20 systems' backend databases replicated hourly or live into a multi-TB PostgreSQL instance. A "clean" (normalised) schema is created from it, a set of views that organises the data into a form that represents the real logic of the business cross-systems. The "raw" schema contains all the replicated databases, the "logical" schema contains the cross-system normalised information, and we're now building the part that gets from the first to the second. The result will be one of the largest relational PostgreSQL deployment in the world.

The next compulsory steps will be:


To complete writing the raw-to-logical mapping, thus modelling and implementing a clean view of all the company's information.
To assist, train, mentor and otherwise lead the existing team into completing the mapping.
To replicate the functional spec of all existing data products within the company (mostly reports).
To expand the team to cover skillsets not currently present or trainable.
To build and provide the ability for the team to answer any question from any part of the business promptly and correctly (such as "what is the average time a package between 2 and 5kg spends being picked in cold storage zones between 9 and 11am in Thailand and Myanmar a week after Chinese New Year").
Optional paths thereafter could be:


To assist the CEO and CTO with their existing statistical learning projects, such as optimising the routing of millions of packages through multiple transport companies and warehouses internationally.
To think of, develop and deploy other data-driven projects such as optimising warehouse picking operations or inventory management.
To train local teams capable of doing the same independently, and support their efforts. This involves travelling around Asia.
Likely useful experience:


Software development (aside from building actual software, you'll need to read a lot of code to understand systems whose logic is not at database level).
A mathematical bend, including awareness of and respect for the ideas behind the relational model ("predicate logic on sets") as defined by Edgar Codd and Chris Date, and rich data types. If you see a foreign key as a mathematical domain and think in terms of relation values and variables, we are probably on the same page.
Knowing your way around PostgreSQL, or failing that any large scale RDBMS deployment; there are infrastructure teams and DBAs but they need your guidance.
At least some enjoyment of the resolution of large, complex problems using more abstract methods as opposed to quick hacks and duct tape.
UNIX/Linux, but if you've read that far you probably have more than enough experience. 
Speaking Chinese (Mandarin) may help a bit but the team has multiple native speakers.
Interview process:


Email vanessa.tan@lazada.com to be sent a few quick questions. Include "6h9mYszLTq2Y" in the subject line so we know you're not a bot.
An hour or two over Skype for probing your technical experience.
An hour or two in Singapore (if you are there) or over Skype for the C-levels to figure out if they can work with you.
subjects: Statistics Probability, Probability, Data & Analytics, Operating Systems, Project Management, Databases, Software Engineering, Management, Productivity, Production, Chinese, Operations, Travel

name: Senior Software Engineer for Digital Health Startup
description:
Company & position overview
BrainCheck is an innovative cognitive health technology company co-founded by neuroscientists Dr. David Eagleman and Dr. Yael Katz. The company recently completed its post-seed fundraising and has market traction with schools and athletic teams, physicians offices, and hospitals. The startup team is operating out of Texas Medical CenterÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs Innovation Center (TMCX+) in Houston.  We are open to remote candidates who are based in the US, Canada or Latin America.  

As we scale our user-adoption and build out exciting new features in the application, we are looking for an experienced engineer to join the team and help drive product innovation. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver who can respond quickly to changing business needs. If this sounds like you and youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre excited to solve big challenges at the cutting edge of healthcare, then reach out and letÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs talk.

Key responsibilities:
*Feature development and maintenance for codebases in Ruby on Rails, Unity, and Ember.
*Maintenance of the automated testing and deployment systems (Jenkins and Travis).
*BrainCheck app deployment and management on AWS.
*Integrating partner apps, such as health monitoring and EMR platforms, with BrainCheck systems.
*Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment a must

Required skills include:
*5+ years of experience working as a software developer
*Working knowledge of modern front-end development and javascript proficiency
*Test driven development procedures and tools
*Familiarity with Unity3D and/or Rails a big plus
*Use of AWS technologies, including EC2, CodeDeploy, and S3, a plus
*Experience building, deploying, and maintaining iOS and Android apps a plusWorking at BrainCheck:
*Join a vibrant team, collaborating to pioneer cognitive health
*Early-stage startup with significant upside potential
*Headquartered at TMCX+ ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ home to dozens of the most innovative startups and innovation labs in the healthcare industry
*We work hard but like to have fun, including happy-hours, ping-pong and other games
*Competitive compensation consisting of cash and equity

More about the Company
BrainCheck takes gold-standard neurocognitive tests and turns them into mobile interactive games, providing a snapshot of an individualÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs cognitive health in about 10 minutes. Our current market offering, BrainCheck Sport, assesses cognitive deficits associated with concussion in sports and athletics, and we also have a direct to consumer version available for iPad and iPhone. Our newly released BrainCheck Memory assesses cognitive and memory impairment associated with dementia, and we are developing a generalized cognitive health tracking tool for the healthy population. BrainCheck has reinvented the process of cognitive assessment to be faster, less expensive, and as reliable as conventional methods.

BrainCheck was developed at the Eagleman Neuroscience Laboratory at Baylor College of Medicine. Dr. David Eagleman has done groundbreaking work on neurocognitive assessment, and he is also a public educator, authoring New York Times bestselling books and appearing regularly on television (most recently PBSÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs series The Brain with David Eagleman). David is joined by CEO, Dr. Yael Katz, neuroscientist and technology executive, and a team of ten outstanding individuals in product, software development, clinical research, marketing, business development, and sales.

No agencies / recruiters, pleaseOnly applicants based in the US, Canada or Latin America will be considered

name: Python Developer
description:
Overview

We're looking for a Python developer to help us continue development of our (mostly) internal-facing web apps. See the current project section for specifics of this gig.

What do we do? We teach leadership to high-performing individuals who want to level up (altmba.com), and we teach marketing that you can be proud of because it's ethical, generous, and effective (themarketingseminar.com). 

In the process we're trying to change online education. Most online courses have a massive drop-out rate, and don't create an environment that enables the student to grow. 

The apps are dashboards and onboarding sites that helps us manage our student experience.

We're looking for someone we can work with long-term, but to start we're going to focus on one new piece of functionality we need to add to the apps.

This is a freelance position, working remotely.

Current Project

We need a UI that lets Sam upload a CSV of students, and gives her back a CSV of payment links for each student. 

We're currently doing this semi-manually. Alex modifies a few config files and then runs a python script from Heroku's command line. Much of the functionality is already developed. What we need is a bit more functionality to check the CSV to make sure it's formatted correctly, and a UI that let's Sam set the config variables and run the process from the web app. 

Tech Notes

The app is built using a procedural programming style (not object-oriented).

Since the app is (mostly) internal-facing we value speed and getting to "good enough," more than we care about performance optimization or eliminating all the bugs. This lets us work in a fast, iterative manner. 

Tech stack


Python 3 
Flask web application framework
Heroku 
Heroku PostgreSQL (via psycopg2 without an ORM)
External APIs connected via requests module: (PayPal, Discourse, Zapier) 
Python modules: (APScheduler, certifi, chardet, click, dropbox, Flask, gunicorn, idna, itsdangerous, Jinja2, MarkupSafe, psycopg2, pytz, requests, six, stripe, tzlocal, urllib3, Werkzeug)

name: Senior Database Reliability Engineer
description:
About the Role

CircleCI is seeking its first Database Reliability Engineer to work closely with our Site Reliability and Software Engineers to deliver and manage the high-performance and scalable data persistence layer underlying our multi-tenant Cloud offering as well as our Server-installed, on-premises solution. You will not only have the chance to automate and optimize infrastructure through the construction of appropriate tooling, but you will help software engineers through the design phase to select, design, and optimize the data persistence for their services.CircleCI uses multiple datastores to support its platform, including Postgres, Mongo, and Redis.

About CircleCI

Velocity is critical for software teams in today's competitive landscape, but maintaining speed can be difficult as apps and systems grow larger and more complex. CircleCIÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs platform allows developers to rapidly release code (for web and mobile apps) they trust by automating the build, test, and deploy process. CircleCI enables developers to detect and fix bugs before they even reach customers. Thousands of leading companies including Facebook, Kickstarter, Shyp and Spotify rely on CircleCI to accelerate delivery of their code and enable developers to focus on creating business value fast.What will make you successful:


Comprehensive knowledge of the internal workings of at least one of Postgres, Mongo, Redis
A collaborative approach to aiding software engineers in the development of fast and reliable data-driven applications
Deep understanding of the tradeoffs in datastore selection and the implications for application design
Passion for modern software development and operation, including agile, CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code
Experience managing large-scale database systems in a cloud environment
Systematic problem solving approach, coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive
Proficiency in one or more of: C, C++, Java, Python, Go
A strong desire for continuous improvement
8+ years of experience

What you will do:

Design and deliver solutions to improve the availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of CircleCIÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs data storage layer
Engage in datastore capacity planning and demand forecasting, anticipating performance bottlenecks
Diagnose and resolve production issues in conjunction with software engineering teams
Architect and implement tooling used by all services within the CircleCI platform, for both SaaS and on-prem configurations
Support and advise software engineering teams in the design of scalable services
Participate in rotating on-call duties, including incident management
Define the requirements for a growing discipline of DBRE at CircleCI

If youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resumÃÂÃÂ© and let us know why youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂd be a great fit for our team. If you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or have a presence on the web (Twitter, GitHub, LinkedIn, etc.) we would love to hear about it.

CircleCI is a Bay Area Best Places to Work 2016 award winner. Founded in 2011 and headquartered in beautiful downtown San Francisco with a global remote workforce, CircleCI is venture backed by Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Baseline Ventures and Harrison Metal Capital.

We care deeply about diversity and inclusivity. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre hiring at all experience levels, and seek talented teammates from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences who are equally committed to cultivating a work environment of respect and kindness. We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply.

name: Senior Node.js developer
description:
WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre looking for a senior Node.js developer with systems experience to join our exciting and evolving project right in the heart of Shoreditch and Old StreetÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂLondonÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs Silicon Valley.

Candidates should:


Share our enthusiasm for a blockchain-powered, decentralised future.
Be senior/lead developers.
Thrive independentlyÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂtake initiative, stay inquisitive, be a self-starter.
Be masters of:


in Node/Express/Mongo
RESTful APIs
Ionic/PhoneGap/Cordova - while role is Node.js focused we expect some interactions with the front-end too
TDD, CI
Agile / Scrum / Kanban
Carry projects through their full life cycle, from ideation to architecture, implementation, and scaling.
Embody a wide-range of both soft and technical skills, from query optimisation and UI design to cloud server setup and building a business canvas model.
Have a strong delivery track record, excellent problem-solving skills, and high interest in all the latest tools.
About us: 

We believe in radical openness, trust, and joy. Pillar is a fully-funded, open-source project designed to give individuals control over their personal data. It starts with an intuitive cryptocurrency walletÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂbut will evolve to become a personal assistant for your digital life. 

WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre still in the early days of product development, which means thereÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs no legacy code. We want to hire senior developers eager to take initiative and mentor junior teammates on the project.

Our vision is pretty bigÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂweÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre disrupting a multibillion-dollar businessesÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂso weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll be in business for decades to come. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre building a team to change the future with us. 

Our team and culture:

Our developers operate with great autonomy. We bring groups of the best people together, set ambitious goals, and work as a team to shape the world we believe in. Our culture is open, informal, and welcomingÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂweÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre proud of our diverse nationalities, personalities, and skill sets. We want everyone to to be themselves, find their place, and love what they do. In that spirit, team members are free to work however they want, as long as it suits them and the project. 

How we hire:

Pillar is an open-source project, our mission is broadcast from the rooftops and our code will be public at first release of the wallet. As such, we try to hire from our community. 

We don't need to see CVs, please simply introduce yourself and tell us why you'd like to help. We ask interested developers to join us in London where weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll grant you access to our repository and get started. First, weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll collaborate for a short period of timeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂyou send in merge requests, we take a look at your code, you take a look at our code, and we can see how we work together. If itÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs mutual, weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂd love to extend you an offer!

We know that our process is unconventional, but it works so far. 

You donÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂt have to be local, but you must have an EU or UK work permit. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre based at Rise London in Shoreditch.

name: Senior Software Engineer (Full stack)
description:
About Us

Grove Collaborative is a digitally native brand and direct-to-consumer e-commerce platform for natural home and personal care products. With a mission to help every family create a healthy, beautiful home, Grove offers a flexible recurring shipment model and gives each customer a personal shopper, a ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂGrove Guide.ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ GroveÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs e-commerce platform makes natural products approachable; half of GroveÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs customers are trying natural for the first time. Every product Grove offers, both from our flagship Grove Collaborative brand and from exceptional third party brands, has been thoroughly vetted for health, sustainability and efficacy. Grove is a Certified B Corporation, a company that prioritizes social, environmental, and community wellbeing as well as profit.

The Team

Our technology helps millions of families make conscientious choices in their everyday lives. From our custom-built recurring order e-commerce platform, to customer service tools that support tens of thousands of customer touches per month, to inventory forecasting and operational software -- weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre focused on building a differentiated, focused service that leaves traditional consumer retailers & brands scrambling to keep up. Our engineering team believes in automated testing, continuous deployment, and shipping valuable software every day. Our primarily technology stack is Django + Python (though we have plenty of Flask, command line, and node applications as well), with ES6 + marionette.js on the front end. On any given day, youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll find engineers collaborating to track down the source of a strange pattern in our metrics, pair programming on a piece of brand new functionality, heads-down on a challenging refactor, or meeting with other departments to understand the business context for what weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre building. We are looking for exceptional developers to take on big challenges, and innovate with our fast growing engineering team.enges, and innovate with our fast growing engineering team. 

The Role

As a full stack developer on the team, you will have a hand in defining the technology that runs grove.co. You will join a team of world class, highly motivated software engineers to deliver a high quality software architecture with the scalability, maintainability, and performance needed to match the staggering growth of our company (5x year-over-year). You love finding practical solutions to problems, that will grow with the company and a proven ability to design, develop, and ship software that customers love.

Your Impact

Work on the core aspects of the Grove.co, allowing our services to perform effectively, efficiently, reliably and with high scalability
Collaborate closely with other engineers to create solid, robust code
Ship high-value features and own the impact of your solutions
Work with product managers to brainstorm and create products that are loved by our customers
Advocate for new and better ways we should develop, and discover and implement new best practices for the development organization
Build frameworks and tools that are used by our customers and internal organizations
Contribute back to the open source projects we rely on

About You

3+ years of strong Python, SQL & Javascript development experience
Note that if you have relevant ecommerce experience, but in a different stack, we still want to talk!
You love clean code and robust design
You value and take responsibility for the quality of your features, including writing your own tests (unit, functional and integration) and reviewing your teammatesÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ code
Keen nose for bad code smells
Motivated and assertive in learning and helping your team be successful
Innovator with good ideas, strong problem solving abilities, and a results oriented attitude
Strong communication and collaboration skills

Our Office

Our office doesn't have nerf guns and we celebrate real revenue milestones, not fundraising goals. We also have:


A beautifully designed open office Located at Polk & Pine St in San Francisco near lots of delicious cafes & restaurants
Fully stocked communal kitchen with on tap Kombucha
Cozy "quiet room" for focussed work
Small dog friendly

name: Software Architect
description:
Software Architect
Heerlen ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ 36 uur

Spreken moderne IT-themaÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs zoals domain driven architectuur, continuous delivery, automatic release management en metadata jou aan? Zie jij het als een uitdaging om te participeren in complexe IT-projecten en deze te begeleiden? Wil jij aan de slag in een ongekend groot applicatielandschap?

Wat ga je doen?

Uit onze laatste sprintreview blijkt dat onze product owners tevreden zijn over onze dienstverlening. We worden daardoor steeds eerder in het proces betrokken en daar zijn we trots op! Vanuit onze ambitie om steeds meer en beter in vaste Scrum teams te gaan werken, vervul jij als Software Architect een cruciale en verbindende rol tussen onze afdeling en de interne klant.

In onze state-of-the-art data en informatie infrastructuur in Heerlen bedenk je ontwerpbeslissingen voor de implementatie van gewenste functionaliteit met behulp van de uiteindelijke techniek. Vanuit jouw kennis en kunde, en adviserende rol, kun jij jouw visie overtuigend neerzetten bij product owners en treedt je op als volwaardig gesprekspartner.

Als meewerkend voorman neem jij de software engineers mee in jouw werkwijze en vind je het leuk inhoudelijke discussies te voeren, om zo van elkaar te leren.

Doordat je een actieve en betrokken rol hebt in grote en complexe projecten, zoals ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂproject DatameerÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ, ben je regelmatig proactief aan de slag met complexe vraagstukken. Enkele van de vraagstukken waar jij je mee bezig mag houden zijn:
Hoe kun je met innovatieve technieken en concepten zoals datavirtualisatie, graph databases, open sourcetools, logical datawarehouse- en metadata concepten en platformen ontwikkelen waarbij statistische data bij de bronnen blijven opgeslagen en op een snelle en eenvoudige manier real-time via een datawebshop ontsloten kunnen worden aan de gebruikers en systemen van het CBS?

Maar ook:Hoe kun je dit platform en concept vervolgens laten uitgroeien tot een platform om data op een veilige maner real-time te delen met externe partijen als overheden, universiteiten, gemeenten en provincies?

Binnen dit project werk je met open source tools en ben je verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van totaaloplossingen. Hiernaast werk je zelf ook hand-on mee in ontwikkelwerkzaamheden.

Wie zoeken wij?

Wij zijn op zoek naar een betrokken en proactieve senior architect die bij voorkeur kennis heeft van datawarehouses en metadata. Hiernaast zien we graag de volgende zaken terug in je cv/brief:


Je beschikt minimaal over een afgeronde HBO opleiding (bij voorkeur informatica of aanverwant)

Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Software Architect, bij voorkeur binnen een of meerdere grote/ complexe organisaties

Je hebt affiniteit met open source tools en bent in staat totaal oplossingen te integreren

Je hebt bij grote voorkeur ervaring in het werken binnen Scrum en/of DevOps teams

Waar kom je te werken?
De directie BIT (Informatietechnologie) bestaat uit 5 afdelingen; Applicatie Services, Technical Services, Customer Services, Solution Services en Stafbureau kwaliteit. BIT is verantwoordelijk voor het beschikbaar stellen ontwikkelen en in stand houden (continuÃÂÃÂ¯teit) van de ICT infrastructuur, staat garant voor ontwikkeling en onderhoud van maatwerk applicaties en is verantwoordelijk voor beheer van maatwerk en standaard applicaties.

IT werkt keihard aan het beheren en vernieuwen van de infrastructuurdiensten, is actief in vele scrumprojecten voor applicatieontwikkeling, investeert nadrukkelijk in het uitbreiden en professionaliseren van IT en zit middenin een belangrijke transitieperiode om aan de steeds toenemende behoefte aan hoogwaardige IT-dienstverlening te kunnen blijven voldoen en toonaangevende resultaten neer te zetten.

IT is, vanwege de grote verwerking van data binnen de organisatie, de ruggengraat van het CBS en speelt daarmee een grote en zeer essentiÃÂÃÂ«le rol binnen de organisatie. De IT binnen het CBS moet dan ook betrouwbaar zijn, daar maken wij ons elke dag hard voor!

Het team
Als team BAS (BIT Applicatie Services) Heerlen hebben we de afgelopen jaren de eerste stappen gezet in Agile werken. De projecten worden uitgevoerd in vaste scrum teams. Het is onze ambitie om hierin steeds te blijven doorgroeien in professionaliteit en effectiviteit, door bijvoorbeeld te groeien in scrum volwassenheid, invulling geven aan DevOps, zoveel mogelijk te automatiseren en steeds met state-of-te art IT te werken. Het totale team van BAS H bestaat uit ca. 40 collegaÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs in Heerlen. Er is ook een BAS team in Den Haag bestaande uit ca. 30 collegaÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs.

''Ons team kenmerkt zich door een open en betrokken sfeer. We werken allemaal hard, zijn druk bezig en tegelijkertijd helpen we elkaar waar nodig. We vieren graag successen en tonen oprechte interesse naar elkaar. We leren graag van elkaar, organiseren regelmatig uitjes en werken via SCRUM om onze doelstellingen te behalen. ''Ralph Schreijen, Software Architect

Wat wij bieden
Het CBS heeft een groot en complex applicatielandschap. Onze data wordt verwerkt in tal van verschillende applicaties, de vraag vanuit de klant is vaak groot en complex. Het CBS biedt hierdoor voor IT-ers voldoende uitdaging en variatie.

Naast een uitdagende werkplek waar jij je domeinkennis kunt vergoten en verbreden bieden we je de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden:


Een salaris van minimaal ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¬3038,90 en maximaal ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¬4669,57 (schaal 11) op basis van 36 uur. De inschaling is afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring

Een vaste eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%

Vakantiegeld uitkering van 8%

Flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheden om thuis te werken

Reiskostenvergoeding en vergoedingen voor thuiswerken

Een werkplek met voldoende ruimte voor jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling

De mogelijkheid om bij een fulltime aanstelling (36 uur) 4 uur per week compensatieverlof op te bouwen

Individuele Keuzen Arbeidsvoorwaarden Pakket; de IKAP regeling stelt je in staat om bijvoorbeeld extra vakantiedagen te kopen of te sporten met korting door middel van belastingvoordeel

Een uitdagende functie voor de duur van 1 jaar met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband

De sollicitatieprocedure

Wil je meer weten over de inhoud van de functie? Neem dan contact op met Terence Jeurgen, Hoofd Applicatie Services, via email tb.jeurgen@cbs.nl. Wil je meer weten over de sollicitatieprocedure dan kun je contact opnemen met Tamara Rood, Corporate Recruiter, op telefoonnummer: 0615850107 of via email: t.rood@cbs.nl

name: Technisch Software Engineer
description:
Technisch Software Engineer
De functie
Ligt jouw passie bij techniek en vind je het leuk om complexe technische uitdagingen aan te gaan? Dan past de functie van Technisch Software Engineer goed bij jou. In deze functie kun je op basis van Technology Consulting and Engineering brede ervaring opdoen binnen verschillende werkgebieden en omgevingen. Voor jou de ideale mogelijkheid om jouw (technische) kennis in te zetten en uit te breiden.Jouw profiel


Een afgeronde opleiding op universitair of hbo-niveau op gebied van Technische Informatica of Elektrotechniek.
    Professionele softwareontwikkelervaring met C/ C++/ C# of Java.
    Je beschikt over goede kennis van en ervaring met OO en UML.
    Je hebt gewerkt met Windows en/of Unix/ Linux ontwikkelomgevingen.
    Pre: ervaring binnen Multithreaded/ Realtime omgevingen.
    Goede sociale en communicatieve vaardigheden.
    Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
Persoonlijkheid
Je beschikt over goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden en vindt het interessant om technische uitdagingen aan te gaan. Binnen uiteenlopende projecten maakt jouw vakmanschap het verschil. Daarnaast ben je proactief ingesteld en werk je graag in teamverband.ALTEN biedt


Technisch uitdagende projecten met volop doorgroeimogelijkheden.
    Direct een vast dienstverband.
    Uitstekend salaris en prima arbeidsvoorwaarden, zoals een lease-auto, premievrije pensioenvoorziening en uiteraard en een breed scala aan opleidingsmogelijkheden.
    Volop aandacht en ruimte voor ontplooiing op zowel technischÃÂÃÂ als persoonlijk vlak.
    Een ambitieuze omgeving met technische collegaÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs.
    Een internationale sfeer met veel contacten door heel Europa.
ALTEN
ALTEN voert via haar kantoren, projecten uit voor vooraanstaande technisch georiÃÂÃÂ«nteerde bedrijven door heel Nederland. Dit kan op locatie bij de opdrachtgever zijn, maar kan ook plaatsvinden op het ALTEN Delivery Center in Eindhoven, Capelle aan den IJssel of Apeldoorn. Je werkzaamheden zijn met name gericht op R&D, waarbij je betrokken wordt bij het opstellen en uitwerken van het design, de implementatie van de software op een kwalitatief hoogstaand niveau. Qua ontwikkel-methodiek wordt bij voorkeur gebruik gemaakt van Agile/ Scrum. Binnen de R&D-omgevingen van de verschillende hightechindustrieÃÂÃÂ«n wordt er steeds meer gebruik gemaakt van hoogstaande softwareoplossingen. Het kwalificeren, ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van deze softwareoplossingen vraagt om een helder en abstract denkniveau en de capaciteiten dit te vertalen naar een praktische oplossing. De daadwerkelijke oplossingen kunnen in verschillende ontwikkelomgevingen gerealiseerd worden. Denk hierbij aan R&D voor de meest uiteenlopende toepassingen binnen bijvoorbeeld de medische, industriÃÂÃÂ«le of informatiesector.
ALTEN heeft ambitieuze groeidoelstellingen voor de komende jaren welke passen binnen de internationale strategie van de ALTEN Groep. Deze groei levert veel kansen op voor getalenteerde ingenieurs die nu kiezen voor een carriÃÂÃÂ¨re bij ALTEN. Werken bij ALTEN biedt volop uitdaging, solliciteer daarom nu via het online sollicitatieformulier om ons team te versterken!Informatie
Neem voor meer informatie vrijblijvend contact op met een van onze Corporate Recruiters: regio Zuid (locatie Eindhoven) via +31(0)40-256 3080, regio West (locatie Capelle aan den IJssel) via +31(0)10-463 7700, regio Oost (locatie Apeldoorn) via +31(0)55-548 6200. Je kunt ook een e-mail sturen naar: sollicitatie@alten.nl.

name: Backend Software Engineer - Java
description:
Company Description

At Netcentric, we come to work every day knowing weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre part of the solution to the most complex challenges brands have ever faced: digital transformation. Consumer expectation of brands is increasing in a world that is more connected and fast-paced.

Netcentric is a dynamic and innovative service provider with a unique culture. We empower our employees to use their creativity, looking beyond tools and technology to unlock the full potential of the Adobe Experience Cloud, so that we can deliver visionary digital marketing solutions for the worldÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs most recognized brands.

As part of the Cognizant Digital Business, we reap the benefits of combined expertise and access to multidisciplinary teams, forging ahead to become a leading customer experience player in Europe.

Our teams are based in some of the worldÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs most exciting cities - in Zurich, Munich, Berlin, Frankfurt, Dresden, Barcelona, Bucharest, London and Amsterdam. In all of our offices, you will find a culture that embraces over 43 different nationalities. You will also find some amazing views, fancy kitchens and cozy breakout areas for a bit of rest and relaxation.

And oh, did we mention that we empower employees to make meaningful decisions at work through Holacracy?

Job Description
Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a Software Engineer who loves web development and loves working with open source frameworks. If you are a team player with a passion for Java, who is willing to develop and learn - keep on reading! Netcentric will feel like home to you if you like to work in a fun, multicultural environment and like to be challenged every day.

Netcentric is powered by an international team of skilled, social people who are all about building innovative digital marketing solutions in the Adobe Experience Cloud. We are a responsive organization that enables everyone to take initiative and contribute to the success of our projects and the company through Holacracy. We focus on technology, delivering quality work and supporting our customers.

Qualifications

 Being a team player

Additional Information

 A proactive mindset, ability to share our ideas and bring them to life
Enthusiasm
 We have open minds always looking for continuous improvement

at Netcentric you get:


 Permanent contract
 Centrally located office in Timpuri Noi with great fitout and standing desks

 International and dynamic team

And much more...!

name: SENIOR MOBILE DEV (F/M)
description:
JOB PROFILE

SENIOR MOBILE DEV (F/M), HAMBURG

The Digital Unit is looking for a talented mobile dev to join our team. In the heart of HafenCity, Hamburg, the Digital Unit is driving the digital transformation at Costa Group (AIDA & Costa Cruises). As a mobile dev with us, you will work with other developers, user experience designers, data analysts and product owners to develop and improve new features while keeping performance, scalability and deployment in mind.

Your code will deploy to and run on the floating cities of the sea - cruise ships. This unique situation calls for a mixed and adaptable set of coding skills. Often the usual taken for granted solutions simply don't work when deployed to a ship. If the sound of this challenge is getting you excited - we'd love to meet you!

THE 'TECH STACK'

We use a variety of technologies to code and ship our products. If Swift for iOS/tvOS, Kotlin for Android or advanced mobile web development tickles your fancy, let's talk! Of course, you're not expected to have mastered it all but deep knowledge of some, along with a hunger to learn new things as needed, is desired.

WHO YOU ARE:

You are an expert in your area, familiar with mobile development challenges as well as sitting down to do some solid functional programming to extend a Backend For Frontend (BFF).
You fancy applying CI/CD techniques and writing automated tests.
You have solid understanding of the full application technology stack, as well as how to handle dropped internet connections in applications.
You could ship an entire mobile app on your own if you wanted to, but prefer working with others to write well-designed, tested, and scalable software in pairs.
You are comfortable communicating in English for coding and in meetings (we try not to have too many).

WHAT WE OFFER:

A bunch of challenges.
A dynamic company culture in the heart of Hamburg in HafenCity.
A team that values the opinions of each member, no matter the role.
A snazzy open office space, with a pro kicker table, conference rooms, a phone booth and a shower.
HVV ProfiTicket discount.
Weekly fresh fruit, free coffee, and water.
Competitive compensation.
If the above describes you and your passions, we look forward to meeting you!

We look forward to receiving your complete application, ideally as an online application at www.aida-jobs.de or by mail to the address listed below.

AIDA Cruises | Human Resources Management | Am Strande 3d | 18055 Rostock

name: Ruby on Rails / Backend Software Developer (f/m)
description:
Mobisol Group is a leading global player in decentralised solar electrification. Driven by market demand for off-grid solutions beyond lighting, Mobisol designs, distributes and services large solar systems, seamlessly integrated with proprietary pay-as-you-go (PAYG) software. By combining the latest high-tech solar hardware with mobile payment technologies, the Berlin based company ensures affordability through flexible payment plans. Mobisol enables rural families and businesses to power a wide range of compatible appliances, such as televisions and stereos, thereby improving people's standard of living and enabling incremental income from new solar-powered businesses. With over 750 employees, Mobisol runs its own operations in Tanzania, Kenya and Rwanda, while providing hardware and software solutions through a growing network of B2B partnerships in another nine countries worldwide.

WHAT THIS JOB IS ABOUT

As Backend Software Developer you are developing and improving the core of PAYGEE, MobisolÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs business software platform. All information, which flows between customers, solar systems, partners and our employees in Berlin and East Africa are managed and shaped by various web and mobile applications.

It will be your task within a team of experienced and self-driven developers to put your fingerprint on the platform that drives Mobisol to deliver the best service and products to our rural customers in East Africa.

YOUR TASKS

Together with our international Software Development Team you:


Push our product further ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ develop new features together with stakeholders across all Mobisol departments and sites
Upgrade our existing software ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ re-design and refactor existing software infrastructure to meet new business or performance requirements
Be a key player in our team ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ take an active part in the development team's processes
Holding the strings together ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ implement interfaces with external and mobile software infrastructure
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS


You have the passion for discovering, evaluating and implementing new technical solutions for MobisolÃÂÃÂ´s vision to plug in the world!
You have an in-depth understanding of high level software mechanisms, and best practices
You have a clear understanding of software architecture and design of web applications especially backend, frontend experience is a plus
You are experienced with Ruby On Rails and how to deal with itÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs limitations
You prefer to work with the *nix based operating systems
You are experienced with agile software development team processes
You love to learn from your new colleagues and share your knowledge with them
You already gained intercultural competence, ideally with work experience abroad


Professional level of English, German or Swahili language skills are considered as an asset


Our Tech Stack


Ruby 2.4, Rails 5 and 4.1 w/ ActiveAdmin, Grape
MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis
SOA around the Middleware using Kafka
Monolith around the frontend which needs modularization
Frontend: HAML, SASS, vue.js and Angular with regular JS
YOUR PERSPECTIVE


Doing something meaningful ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ youÃÂÃÂ´ll be part of an enterprise that brings real positive impact to ordinary people in East Africa
Personal development ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ beside new experiences of developing in an international context with new technologies, we support you with possibilities for participation in Hackathons, developer conferences and classical trainings
Be part of a great team of people ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ who combine professional expertise with individual passion
Flat hierarchies and unusual ways to do things ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ your ideas and experiences are more than welcome
HOW TO APPLY

Important for us are your skills and your motivation rather than certificates or university degrees. Please apply via our job portal. if you have further questions donÃÂÃÂ´t hesitate to
contact:

David Senftleben ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Phone: +49 30/ 9700 - 2556 ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ e-Mail: jobs@plugintheworld.com

name: DevOps Engineer (f/m) IT automation
description:
The censhare Digital Experience Platform pools all marketing and communications content within one information-centric system and a consistent user interface. The best of breed applications for Collaboration, DAM, PIM, Omnichannel CMS and MRM allow to create relevant digital experiences from real-time information. More than 150 companies, like Dyson, GoPro, Hearst, Kohl's, Serviceplan, Migros, Rewe, Swiss Re and Vitra are using censhare on a daily basis. 

You have a passion for exploring new things and a general interest in pushing DevOps to its limits? You are experienced in System Administration, IT automation, programming and have already worked in a DevOps environment?
If you would enjoy shaping the growth of a dynamic company with international operations, an exciting challenge awaits you.

For our headquarters in Munich we are looking, for the next possible date, for you as one of our new:

DevOps Engineer (f/m) IT automation 

What awaits you as a DevOps Engineer at censhare?
As a DevOps engineer you will primarily join our IT Operations team. However, you will also work with the virtual DevOps team to facilitate, promote and develop DevOps practices and tools to help our IT.

Your job as a DevOps Engineer:


Support of our Ansible automation project in collaboration with IT Operations team

Further development of our ELK stack to support in-depth infrastructure/application monitoring and log management

Manage the existing DevOps tools, such as AWX (Ansible Tower), Gitlab, Rancher, Kubernetes, Artifactory,ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¦

Work on the continuous improvement of our CI/CD pipelines

Support in improving the IT Operations' day-to-day work
Your profile as a DevOps Engineer:


Long-term experience as a System Administrator in a Linux/Unix environment

Advanced knowledge of configuration management tool (Ansible, puppet, chef)

Knowledge of Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (Jenkins, TeamCity, GibLab CI, Bamboo)

Familiarity with GIT or other VCS tool.

Knowledge of Vitual Machines and Container (Docker, rkt)

Knowledge of K/V and registry tools (etcd, consul) and Orchestration tools (Kubernetes, rancher, nomad).

You are familiar with development workflows in an agile software development environment because we are using SAFe
Our input


Our corporate culture is distinguished by its friendly solidarity and the respectful manner with which we treat each one another - we are a great team, keen on celebrating success together.

We count on flat hierarchies and quick decision-making channels. Every employee has the possibility to contribute to the company's development. This is why we conduct monthly pulse surveys and implemented our circle structure, which allows our employees from any department to get involved with any project which may spark their interest.

You can find a large scope for personal and professional development: aside from the annual development dialogue with your manager, by using a dedicated tool you are able to give and request feedback from anybody at any time.

We offer flexible working hours and a possibility for home office.

With our GymPass membership packages, there is something in for fitness enthusiasts and the ones who want to enjoy a good sauna from time to time.

Last but not least: Coffee, water and fruit are available free of charge. And our own cook pampers our employees by providing delicious quality lunch!
About us
All over the world, leading companies and brands place their trust in censhare in integrating and automating their communication. Our customer and project portfolio encompass virtually all sectors and company sizes. These activities are driven and advanced by more than 300 employees across the world, with subsidiaries in Germany, Switzerland, UK, France, USA, the Netherlands, Sweden and India. We are working with highly motivated, competent colleagues coming from more than 30 different nations using cutting-edge technologies across cultures.

Sounds interesting?
Are you interested in this exciting challenge? If so, we look forward to receiving your application as a "DevOps Engineer (f/m) IT automation" in German or English and your salary expectations as well as the earliest date on which you can join the company. Please send your application via this link .

If you have any questions, please reach out to Patrick Molnar by e-mail to recruiting@censhare.com.

name: Software Engineer (Python, Java, C++, or PHP)
description:
Who We Are:

BlindData is an innovative platform built to identify the very best programmers using our proprietary standardized testing. Designed by award-winning programmers as well as distinguished professors at top computer science universities, our technology-driven approach utilizes adaptive multiple choice and coding tests to uniformly assess software engineering knowledge and ability. Our exams test for advanced logical thinking, complex programming skills and performance potential. 

What We Do:

We have developed the "SATs" for software engineers. Our mission is to eliminate unnecessary bias within hiring processes through rigorous assessment methods in JAVA, Python, C++ and PHP. Candidates that make it through our testing and screening process are among the top programmers on the market. With thousands of BlindData Candidates, we can quickly optimize the tech hiring process for companies both large and small. 

What YouÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll Do:
Collaborate with our testing problem contributors to author, edit and deploy coding challenges on our platform.
Constantly enhance platform performance and help scale our system as we grow.
Create experiences for app and web environments. 
Partner with Lead Developer and CTO on various projects.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables. 
Maintain and iterate on company website and overall user experience for candidates and partners.
Work on a small, agile and growing team to help us build out the business and expand our user base.

Who You Are:

Applicants should be highly skilled in one of Python, C++, Java, PHP. We are a small but growing company looking to hire top technical talent.

If you are interested in applying, visit www.blinddata.com/r/handshake and click on ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂTest your Talents!ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ to take our 20-minute online challenge. ItÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs as easy as that! This fast and free evaluation will help us assess your fit for applicable roles within our company. Your online challenge score will determine if you are invited to the final round which consists of an in-person exam. After that point, you will become BlindData Certified and be considered for open roles on our team. 

Minimum Qualifications:
Coding experience in Java, Python, C++, PHP
Have experience with API design
Have experience with AWS services
Have experience with frontend frameworks
Exceptional distributed systems programming skills
Familiarity with SQL and databases

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with financial software, especially within Fixed Income and financial broker/exchange APIs (e.g. price feeds, order execution) a plus
Experience with real-time distributed systems and fast-cycle version iterations
Degree in Computer Science or related field

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Join our Family 

Stride Consulting is a mission-driven, engineering-centric company. We seek developers who place a high value on continuous learning, and value diversity. If you consider yourself a non-dogmatic engineer, have a thirst for learning, and an eye for process, youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre in great company. 

Our goal is to leave our clients functioning at a higher level than when we found them.  We do this by writing high quality code alongside them, and by mentoring their developers, product teams and stakeholders in software development best practices. 

We believe that practices like Test Driven Development, Pairing and Refactoring are the foundation of a high functioning software team. And, we believe that not all Agile practices provide equal value to all teams at all times. So, we approach each engagement as the unique opportunity it is. 

As a Strider, youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll find an opportunity thatÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs unmatched. You will:


Be part of an engineering-driven culture, one that has a 4.9 star Glassdoor review and thatÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs won CrainÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs Best Places to Work 2 years in a row.
Write high-quality code with some of the smartest engineers in town.
Mentor Stride and client engineers.
Immerse yourself in a learning journey thatÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs second to none. No where else will you find the variety that being a consultant brings, all a subway ride away.
Day In The Life of a Senior Software Engineer

You are empowered to define what work/life balance means to you. As a Strider, youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll work onsite at your client. We are proud to call some of NYCÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs most outstanding tech teams our clients, from startups to enterprise.  

You will be part of a Stride team, on a client engagement. Your work week will involve 70%-80% client work, including coding, and mentoring Agile engineering best practices. The rest of your time will be spent on things like: managing Striders, being the engagement lead on your client, owning company-level initiatives, being a thought leader.

                                                     HereÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs how a day might unfold:


9am: One-on-one meeting with the clientÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs CTO.  IÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂm the engagement lead on my client. I meet with the CTO weekly. We go over the plans for the week and give each other feedback. I take notes so I can relay the info to the team. 

10am: Daily Standup. Standup lasts 5 minutes and then weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre off to code.

10:10-12:30 Pair Programming. This morning, IÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂm pairing with another Strider. SheÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs been coding 3 years, and sheÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs got strong fundamentals. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre doing a deep dive into complex backend code. IÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂm asking questions when I see she gets stuck. She notices a refactoring opportunity and we jump in. 

12:30-1:30 Lunch with my team Every Strider gets a company AmEx. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre encouraged to grab lunch, coffee with our team and/or client to get to know each other. We talk business for 30 minutes and the rest of the time we talk about rock climbing and a new strategy board game Derek bought last week.

1:30-4:00 Pair Programming

4- 5:Sprint Retrospective Retrospectives on my team are amazing. We take turns facilitating, and today we retrospect our last release. 

5-6: Stride U DevOps Jam Stride U is ongoing education for Striders by Striders. Seven of us are taking the DevOps Jam course, itÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs 1 hour weekly, for 8 weeks.  DevOps is something IÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂm dipping a toe in and having a safe space to learn real world stuff that I can bring back to my client is great. 

6pm: Leave for the Day. ItÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs been a good day, I throw on my headphones as I head to the subway. 

                                                               What youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll be doing



Your job: write high quality code, and bring a ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂteach a team to fishÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ mentality to your project:
Embed with development teams in some of NYCÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs most exciting tech teams to help them up their game and get stuff done.
Mentor teams on the value of software development best practices like Test Driven Development (TDD), Pair Programming, Collective Code Ownership, Continuous Deployment, and Continuous Improvement
Be the reason your client teams are higher performing on your last day with them than they were on your first day.
Lead or be part of a cross functional team 
Take on engagement lead responsibility if you choose.
Take on engineering management responsibility if you choose. 

Work with and learn a variety of tech stacks, and a see a variety of tech teams. We code in modern tech stacks such as Ruby on Rails, React, Angular, Python, Scala, Java8, Elixir, Node and more. 

                                                    YouÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre a fit if you have:


4+ years of software development experience
Proficiency in multiple programming languages and ability to quickly gain proficiency in unfamiliar languages
Passion for seeing projects through from inception to deployment

Experience teaching TDD, story estimation, test writing, and pair programming

                                                    What you can expect from us:


Continuous learning on things that you are passionate about
Competitive Pay and Benefits (including Profit Sharing!)
Empowerment to work at a self-defined sustainable pace
No travel
$2,000 and up to two weeks of your time for professional development
subjects: Programming Languages, Project Management, Software Testing, Software Engineering, Game Development, Management, Productivity, Production, Strategy, Fitness, Other Programming, Gaming, Travel

name: Backend Engineer
description:
NurseGrid believes that those who do the most important work deserve the best technology.  Over the past four years, weÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂve created the number one nurse app in the United States and rolled out our SaaS solution to hundreds of nurse managers. Now we are ready to go even further. Our eleven-person product team is looking to add two Backend Engineers to help us achieve our goal of becoming the must-have mobile app and cloud-based schedule management software for nurses everywhere. If you want to work with a fast-paced development team that has proven its success ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ but still has many goals to achieve ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ then we hope youÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂll apply!

The Backend Engineer is responsible for developing and maintaining backend APIs that support our core consumer and enterprise-level mobile applications. They will work closely with the Mobile and Engineering teams to help define, develop, and support initiatives that drive key business goals and objectives.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Develop, deploy, and maintain APIs for production-level mobile applications
Collaborate with the Mobile team in designing new features/workflows and iterating upon existing features/workflows
Provide detailed API specifications and support for the mobile engineers
Consistently improve upon legacy APIs
Work closely with the Engineering team to ensure pattern and systems alignment across the platform
Collaborate with the Engineering team to debug and improve lower-level systems and patterns (data strategies, deployment systems, etc.)
Engage with the Customer Success team to help diagnose mobile-specific user issues and feedback
QUALIFICATIONS:


Proven experience shipping production-ready, mobile-facing APIs
3+ years of working experience with PHP and MySQL
Experience working closely with product and engineering teams to deliver performant and flexible APIs
Proven ability to navigate and iterate upon existing APIs and platform systems
In-depth understanding of supporting a wide variety of clients, network conditions, and legacy application versions
Demonstrated efficiency within a fast-paced and autonomous product development environment
BONUS POINTS FOR:


Experience integrating with external APIs and/or data sources
Exposure to native mobile application development tools and workflows (Swift, Java, React Native, etc.)
Systems administration/development operations experience (Unix, Chef, Ubuntu, etc.)
Experience setting up and maintaining AWS infrastructure
Working knowledge and/or interest in other server-side languages, frameworks, or database systems (Ruby on Rails, Node.js, MongoDB, etc.)
ABOUT NURSEGRID:

NurseGrid is a Portland-grown and venture-backed startup founded in 2013. With the mission of creating technology for nurses that makes their personal lives better, their professional lives more efficient, and contributing to improved outcomes in healthcare, we build innovative staffing, scheduling, and communication technology solutions for the healthcare industry. Over 500k nurses have downloaded our free mobile app (NurseGrid Mobile) and hundreds of nurse managers throughout the United States have activated accounts for our paid SaaS solution (NurseGrid Manager).

We are a small (33 person) but growing and always dynamic team. We work hard and produce high-quality work at a rapid pace, but we also have a ping pong table in our office, a couple non-work related Slack channels, a company volunteering initiative, and dog-friendly work environment. WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre located in the heart of Old Town in Portland with Ground Kontrol right around the corner, and multiple transportation routes to the office. We offer a generous PTO package, medical/dental/vision benefits, work-from-home-Wednesdays, and six optional remote work days per quarter. Come enjoy the work, connect with the team, and set aside some time to enjoy everything the Northwest has to offer!

name: Software Engineer
description:
Wayfair is doing some exciting things!  Our team needs to grow so we're seeking experienced Software Engineers for our Supplier Extranet team to help create and deliver cutting edge business integration applications used by tens of thousands of suppliers in the global supply chain. As a Software Engineer, you will work closely with product managers and business stakeholders, be involved in product design, and constantly think about how to use technology to improve business processes. You'll have a huge impact on WayfairÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs growing business in Europe and the US.

Our methods are collaborative, our group is inclusive, and our minds are exploratory. We encourage skill building, knowledge sharing, and professional growth.

Responsibilities include:

Design and develop web applications using PHP, Javascript / React, CSS / SCSS, Mustache template in an MVC framework
Help maintain these applications by providing production support and fixing bugs
Produce robust and scalable software and web service based architecture that performs well under high load
Perform MS SQL database design, advanced query development, and data optimization using SQL Server Management Studio
Interface with internal and external product managers and end-users to analyze requirements and define user interface design
Direct system testing and validation procedures

Our ideal candidates are those who have:

Experience in object oriented web development experience
Experience working with relational database management systems
Knowledge of HTTP and web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Experience and/or desire to work in an agile environment
Interest in being challenged in a fast-paced environment while having fun
Analytical and creative mindset and a passion for solving business problems with technology
Ability to quickly translate business requirements into working features
Good communication skills and a willingness to collaborate with other engineering teams

We are looking forward to your application, ideally including code samples (e.g. on GitHub)

Our Promise:

A competitive salary and bonus that come along with a unique work/life balance
A company culture driven by pioneer-thinking and talent that crosses departments and hierarchies
Great mentors and career development opportunities through our learn@work program
We contribute to your gym membership and offer free Yoga classes, as well as Wellness Weeks with massages, workshops, and other exciting events
Of course fresh fruits, snacks and drinks every day!
WeÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂre in the heart of the Berlin startup scene with lots of space to encourage collaboration and teamwork
Not in Berlin?  Relocation assistance is offered for these roles
LetÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs not forget the chance to join the next global giant in e-commerce

name: Software Developer .NET
description:
Software Developer .NETJouw bijdrage
Het ICT-landschap van HZPC is flink in beweging. Er wordt hard gewerkt aan innovatieve manieren om de business optimaal te ondersteunen op technisch gebied. Jij wordt de eerste .NET Developer in onze organisatie en krijgt de verantwoordelijkheid en vrijheid om deze rol vorm te geven.
De eerste periode komt je focus te liggen op ons Researchbedrijf. Het Researchbedrijf houdt zich continue bezig met het veredelen van nieuwe aardappelrassen. Dit complexe proces wordt ondersteund door een applicatie die in eigen beheer ontwikkeld is. Deze applicatie is ontwikkeld in Oracle Forms. Er wordt op korte termijn een project gestart om de applicatie te moderniseren door middel van moderne technieken en architectuur met een nieuwe gebruikerservaring. Voor dit project en het hieruit volgende beheer en onderhoud zijn wij op zoek naar een Software Developer. Tijdens dit project draai je mee in een multifunctioneel Agile-team van 6 tot 7 personen. Concreet heb je de volgende hoofdtaken:


Het mee-ontwikkelen van de business applicatie voor Research.
    Omdat de business applicatie gevoed wordt met data uit verschillende afdelingen van het Researchbedrijf zullen er ook extra applicaties ontwikkeld worden om die bedrijfsprocessen verder te automatiseren.
    Interfaces maken voor de business-applicatie.
    Het ontwikkelen van rapportages.
    Na dit project blijf je als Developer samen met de Oracle Engineer verantwoordelijk om alle functionele wensen van de business te ontwikkelen.
    Door de groeiende hoeveelheid data zal je een belangrijk aandeel houden in het integreren van nieuwe analysetools en apparatuur.
Jouw profiel
We zijn op zoek naar een allround, zelfstandige Developer die het leuk vindt om met de business tot goed werkende oplossingen te komen. Jij neemt initiatief om de behoefte boven tafel te krijgen en vertaalt dit naar passende oplossingen. Als aanspreekpunt voor de business zal je je goed moeten verdiepen in de materie van veredeling en onderzoeksmethoden. Daarnaast heb/ben je:



ruime ervaring met het .NET Framework en TFS;
    ervaring als softwarearchitect;
    ervaring met Agile-ontwikkelmethoden (Scrum);
    kennis van BI-tools (bijvoorbeeld: Birst, Power BI);
    communicatief vaardig, zowel mondeling en schriftelijk;
    klantgericht, proactief en heb je een probleemoplossende werkhouding;
    
hbo-niveau, ICT-gerelateerde opleiding;
    een aantal jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare functie;
    goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.
Wij bieden jou


Een carriÃÂÃÂ¨re in een gezonde en groeiende internationale omgeving.
    Veel vrijheid om je werk naar eigen inzicht in te vullen in een informele omgeving.
    Een voltijd dienstverband en een competitief salaris.
    Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een dertiende maand, premievrij pensioen, reiskostenvergoeding en een jaarlijkse collectief variabele beloning.
    Een contract voor een jaar met de wederzijdse intentie daarna over te gaan op een contract voor onbepaalde tijd.

Je werkt vanuit Joure en Metslawier, Friesland. De ICT-afdeling zit op ons hoofdkantoor in Joure. Voor het werk aan de business applicatie voor Research zal je veel in Metslawier zijn.Over HZPC
HZPC is wereldwijd marktleider in pootgoed en een multinational van Nederlandse oorsprong. Innovatie staat centraal bij het kweken van nieuwe aardappelrassen die optimaal aansluiten op lokale groeiomstandigheden en vraag vanuit de markt. Ons team van 350+ collegaÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs werkt vanuit 10+ landen en we exporteren pootaardappelen naar meer dan 80 landen. Meer informatie is te vinden op hzpc.com.Jouw reactie
We kijken uit naar je reactie! We willen je vragen uiterlijk 4 maart 2018 te reageren via het online sollicitatieformulier.
Voor vragen en/of opmerkingen over de functie-inhoud of de procedure kun je terecht bij Jephtha Verheijen, HR-Adviseur, viaÃÂÃÂ jephtha.verheijen@hzpc.comÃÂÃÂ ofÃÂÃÂ 06-57086197.Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

name: Coordination Officer/Analyst for IT Applications
description:
The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Legal Directorate (JU) ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Coordination Unit (COORD) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a:

Coordination Officer/Analyst for IT Applications

This is a full time position at grade 4/5
The term of the contract will be 4 years. 
Panel interviews are anticipated for the end of April
The EIB offers fixed-term contracts of up to a maximum of 6 years, according to its business needs, with a possibility to convert to a permanent contract, subject to organisational requirements and individual performance.

Purpose
Within the Coordination of the Legal Directorate, the (Associate) Coordination Officer for IT applications will coordinate the maintenance, assistance, development and deployment of IT applications for the Legal Directorate in coordination with another IT Officer, liaising with the legal Department(s) / Division(s) and ensuring successful final delivery. S/he will advise JU Management on the modernisation and efficiency of the Directorate in relation to IT matters and act as an interface with the IT Department

Operating Network
The Coordination Officer/Analyst for IT Applications reports to the Head of the Coordination and on projects / assignments to JU Directors, working in close collaboration with JU divisions and various other counterparts. S/he drives contributions needed for ensuring that the Directorate has customer friendly and effective IT applications supporting legal processes, and collaborates closely with the IT Department on the development and delivery of such applications. Main network includes: JU management, Coordination & IT Officer, Knowledge Management Specialist, working groups, JU internal clients, IT Services, and external consultants.

Accountabilities


Define, on a continuous basis, the needs of the JU Directorate for IT applications and how they can be best met internally or via outsourcing, ensuring final delivery, assistance / maintenance and monitoring satisfaction
Find ways to optimise / integrate existing technology and projects, taking into account the needs of the Legal Directorate relative to the overall IT environment of the Bank; propose feasible innovations
Play the role of change agent / innovator, taking particular care of the population of lawyers, paralegals and legal assistants: foster best practices, automation of templates / documents and workflows, digitalisation, efficiency, customer -friendliness of applications, optimal structure and use of internal / external data-bases, archives, intranet
Lead and / or participate in projects related to IT applications for the Legal Directorate, taking care of all their components (e.g. liaison with lawyers, legal needs / specifications, final deliverables, pilots, testing, documentation, information / training on new legal applications, assistance, assurance of customer -friendliness and internal customer -satisfaction, support to lawyersÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ working groups)
Ensure local maintenance and assistance to internal clients concerning existing IT applications, liaising with central IT-Services
Coordinate inputs needed for mapping, standardising, controlling, and automating legal processes and related documents / templates / electronic records / archives
Be subject - matter expert for the definition of records (EIB business glossary) and play the role of document / record steward for the Legal Directorate, liaising with lawyers on all activities related to legal processes (e.g. internal control framework for risk management of processes, manuals of procedures, coordination of the digitalisation of archives, confidentiality policy, ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¦)
Collaborate on all above responsibilities in particular with the other Coordination & IT Officer and the JU Knowledge Management Specialist
Flexibly contribute to other tasks that may be assigned by the Head of Coordination
Qualifications


University degree, preferably in Law and / or in another area relevant to the job
At least 3 years of successful relevant professional experience in a similar job
Proven track record in ensuring development and successful implementation, assistance and maintenance of IT applications relating to legal documentation, ideally acquired at major law firms and in organisations similar to the EIB
Project management and business analysis skills will be a distinct asset
Excellent knowledge of IT applications relating to legal documentation and related best-practices
Knowledge of IT applications used by the EIB will be a distinct asset (e.g. HotDocs, Sharepoint, Opentext / GED, SERAPIS / Lending application, PeopleSoft Time & Labour, Drupal / Intranet, Business Objects, market -leading legal data -bases, standard MS office-applications)
Excellent organisational skills and ability to prioritise and meet deadlines, with strong result and customer orientation
Understanding of the operational, institutional, and legal framework of the EIB or similar organisations
Understanding of the EIB ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs mission, organisation and activities
Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English and a good command of French (*)
Competencies


Achievement Drive: continually keeps an eye on performance, focusing on improving it, showing drive and determination to meet short and long-term goals.
Change Orientation: Adapts to differences and changes in the environment; takes a flexible approach to reach outcomes.
Collaboration: Works cooperatively as part of a team; works collaboratively with peers across organisational boundaries based on a genuine interest in and an accurate understanding of others and their individual perspectives and concerns. 
Organisational Commitment: Is willing to commit to an organisation whose mission is to support Europe and is open to diversity, and to align her/his own behaviour with the organisationÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs needs and intrinsic values, acting  with integrity in ways that promote the organisationÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs mission, policies and rules.
(*) There may be certain flexibility on this requirement, but limited to particularly suitable candidates who may not yet be proficient in French. If selected, such candidates will be hired on the condition that they build up rapidly knowledge of French and accept that their future career in the EIB may be subject to the attainment of sufficient proficiency in both of the Bank's working languages.
Deadline for applications: 11th March 2018

We believe that Diversity is good for our people and our business. We promote and value diversity and inclusion among our staff and candidates; irrespective of their gender, age, nationality, race, culture, education and experience, religious beliefs, sexual orientation or disability

name: Systems Analyst/Programmer, Libraries Information Technology
description:
Columbia University Libraries seeks a motivated and collaborative Systems Analyst/Programmer to join the Libraries Information Technology (LIT) division. 
Under general supervision, develops specifications and requirements for database applications in support of library programs; programs, enhances, modifies, and expands new and existing database applications and related programs; installs and integrates vendor-supplied database applications. 
Detailed responsibilities include but are not limited to: 


programming, debugging, and documenting complex software applications, including batch interface properties for database applications.
consulting with Libraries staff to develop application functional requirements, conducting data analyses and preparing specifications.
preparing program design descriptions, models and prototypes, modifying specifications to improve design and functionality, in consultation with other technical staff.
managing security policies, access permissions, and disaster recovery for mission-critical data on servers and desktop systems.
installing and integrating vendor-supplied database applications.
acting as a resource and consultant to staff involved in related projects and performing other duties as assigned.
As one of the world's leading research universities, Columbia University in the City of New York provides outstanding opportunities to work and grow in a dynamic multicultural intellectual community. The Columbia University Libraries comprises a diverse, collegial and engaged staff committed to furthering the UniversityÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂs teaching and research mission through innovation, leadership, collaboration and professionalism.
Minimum Qualifications: 


Bachelor's degree and a minimum three yearsÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ related experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Experience in progressive analysis and programming.
Development experience in UNIX.
Proficiency in one or more appropriate application development languages (such as perl, PHP, python, ruby). 
Development experience in MySQL, Oracle, and/or Microsoft SQL environments. 
Familiarity with the design and programming of relational database applications. 
Familiarity with MARC, JSON, XML
Ability to perform systems analysis and programming independently, under general direction. 
Strong verbal and written communication skills. 
Must be able to balance priorities and meet deadlines on multiple tasks.
Commitment to supporting and working in a diverse environment.
Preferred Qualifications: 
Previous experience with automation applications in a library environment strongly preferred.
Submit an application on-line at https://jobs.columbia.edu/applicants/Central?quickFind=167631

Columbia University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and strongly encourages individuals of all backgrounds and cultures to consider this position.

name: Sr. full-stack engineer
description:
We created Sticker Mule to be the best place to work and shop. That means making ordering fast, simple and fun while creating a stable, low stress and enjoyable place for talented people to work. 

We're searching for more to join us as we look to build one of the Internet's best technical teams. Some of our current projects include migrating to a service architecture, inter-service communication with GCloud PubSub and GRPC, API Gateway based GraphQL, event sourcing persistence and CQRS, and manufacturing and artwork processing automation. 

See more about our teams here

Why we enjoy working here  
1. We work flexible hours with an asynchronous culture. 
2. We work at a sustainable pace without unreasonable external deadlines. 
3. Varied, interesting technical challenges to work on. 
4. Opportunities to make a large impact as part of a small, highly motivated team.

Our tech stack 
1. Backend: Ruby on Rails, NodeJS, Go 
2. DB: Aurora/Mysql, Postgres, Redis 
3. Frontend:  React, Redux, Webpack 
4. APIS: GraphQL, GRPC, GCloud PubSub 
5. AWS, migrating to Gcloud 
6. Docker, Kubernetes

What you will do 
1. Design, build, test, deploy and maintain web applications and services. 
2. Write clean, performant code in accordance with our team's code style guidelines. 
3. Work to improve and maintain the code health of all of our software. 
4. Collaborate with team leads and stakeholders to ensure that we're always building the best possible solution in the optimal way. 
5. Participate in peer code reviews. 
6. Share expertise with other members of the team and mentor junior developers.

Requirements 
1. 5+ years of professional software development experience. 
2. Deep understanding of Javascript. 
3. Experience with back-end programming, especially in NodeJS 
4. Experience working in and building single page applications, especially with React+Redux 
5. Experience in software architecture and writing specifications 
6. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. 
7. Excellent written and spoken English. 
8. Experience in functional programming would be highly beneficial 
9. Experience with Ruby would be beneficial

Application requirements 
1. Applicants will be sent a Hackerrank test within 1-3 days of applying. 
2. Test must be completed within 5 days.

name: C++ Game Developer ÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ Games Studio
description:
We are looking for a super-talented C++ Game Developer to join us in our London shared studio support team, building tools and features across the entire Farm Heroes Franchise and beyond. You will work collaborativelyon a team to build features to meet the needs of several game teams. We like to rotate responsibilities regularly, so you will have a chance to work with several different technologies.

YOUR ROLE

As part of the development team you will enjoy a creative, challenging and collaborative environment where your ideas will be every bit as valued as your programming expertise.
Some of your responsibilities:


Design, implement and test features for games, tools and pipelines.
Maintain, optimize and refactor existing features
Deliver high quality and well-structured code
Share knowledge and help colleagues across the studio
SKILLS TO CREATE THRILLS

ou are a programmer that enjoys an array of challenges, and strive to deliver great products and technology. You are a curious and fast-learner, and are excited to contribute to live games with a massive user base.


Excellent C++ knowledge
Passion for game development
Ability to work closely with game teams to understand their needs
High sense of quality and polish
BONUS SKILLS


Experience in cross platform game development:
iOS/Android/HTML5 Ability to develop on multiple platforms: Windows and OSX with Linux backends
Frontend web development skills, ReactJS, TypeScript, HTML5
Unity experience, especially in production environments
Build pipeline & automation, Jenkins, Puppet, CMake, Gradle
Experience in working with memory / performance critical applications
Experience maintaining live games
A GREAT SAGA NEEDS ALL SORT OF HEROES

Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace, great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply canÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂt expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes. WEÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂRE SERIOUSLY PLAYFUL
